{"text": "Cities:Skylines,  игра от Colossal Order, известной также по дилогии транспортных менеджеров Cities in Motion - пожалуй, это одна из тех игр, которая меня не оставила равнодушным. Это лучший градостроительный симулятор на сегодняшнее время. Достоинств у игры море, такие как подстройка игры под себя, постоянные обновления или понятное и интутивное строительство своих транспортных маршрутов, чего никогда я в градостроительных симах подобного рода я не видел, но наиглавнейшим я считаю огромный простор для творчества, который должен быть присущ любой игре подобного плана: карты разных размеров и ландшафтов как ванильные, так и из Мастерской; модификации на вкус и цвет; нахождение своего творческого подхода к любой проблеме, связанного с городом. Почти все крупные недостатки связаны скорее больше с мелкими геймплейными, техническими и околоигровыми проблемами а-ля оптимизации и распил большой (но не львиной) части потенциала игры на DLC, что, конечно, грустно, но терпимо. Но тем не менее, я рекомендую вам эту игру. Можно подумать, что я эту игру перехваливаю, но поверьте, её хвалить есть за что. {"text": "Hunt: Showdown is a first person shooter experience like no other. The main gameplay is going into a mission/raid, with the goal to fulfil one or more bounty contracts by tracking down the contract targets by gathering \"clues\" from various points on the map. With up to 12 players (split into duo or trio teams) per match, and at most 2 contract targets, players will fight eachother in attempt to cash out the bounty for themselves. This is where i personally think the exciting part is. Some may say hunt is a battle royale, but it is not. It has many similarities, but there's a few factors that separate it from the BR genre. First of all, you use a hunter, that you equipped gear on before going into the match. 2nd, you have the option to go to one of three extraction points to leave the match, and keep your hunter and your gear, instead of losing a precious leveled hunter and costly weapons/tools, in case you ever get into an \"Impossible\" situation. The combat is much more slow paced than regular shooters, since you use weapons from the mid to end of the 1800s. Every shot matters, and headshots are very rewarding. A headshot is always an instant kill given that you are not shooting at an extreme range or using a shotgun/crossbow. There are many guns to chose from, and all of them will be usable if used correctly. In and outside of combat, sound is extremely important. The (2 currently) maps are full of living and non living audio traps that you can trigger should you not be careful enough. Most of these traps can be heard some hundred meters away. Gunshots can be heard across the entire 1000m x 1000m map. Great, gritty atmosphere, with many kinds of AI with different behaviour. Overall world and lighting is beautiful. Can be a bit CPU heavy. I would recommend trying to find a performance video with your specs should you be concerned An absolutely solid buy, but all the mechanics, what you can/can't do etc takes some getting used to. Heavily recommended to play with a friend.", "appid": "594650", "steamid": "profiles/76561198159186239", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1586865600.0}

{"text": "Chicken is my new pet <3", "appid": "738520", "steamid": "profiles/76561198142584594", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "4", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1536926400.0}
{"text": "10/10 Have a talking Orca named Halo as a crew member. In all seriousness the game is not the end all be all of games, but it is certainly worth your time for a night on the town to see if you'd like to stay. Gameplay Preface this reveiw with the knowledge that I'm a PvE/Co-op only scrub so I won't be talking about the actual multiplayer. The Co-op is laid out and plays the same way as the actual multiplayer though, so I feel confident enough to write this review.  The game in essence is a MOBA esque star ship them up. There are five seperate sectors that you have to \"jump\" between where the game plays out in. There are the two main bases from which each team will set out that is guarded by some, actually rather vicious, AI flakk turrets. There are two side sectors where most of the combat takes place. There are five capture points in each, the last one of each gives access to their respective base and the three inbetween gives points that go towards upgrading your ships. Finally there is a middle sector that gets activated periodically throughout the game which gives a large combat buff when captured. This may not seem like much, but with all \"Hero\" games, the depth of the game is found in the avatars that players use to interact in game. The ships are one of if not the strongest aspect of this game. Each one is unique and has a different playstyle. They all look different, but they are internally consistent with the three ship companies found in the game. There are ships for about every playstyle you could think of and some you didn't think of. Shipborne plasma flamethrowers anyone? My personal favorite happens to be the Leviathan which has a very large and dangerous beam weapon with one of the most satisfying firing sounds I've ever heard in a video game. There is a new PvE horde mode, that while I'd love to comment more on it, I've crashed multiple times during the matches and haven't been able to actually finish one. Although I must give props to the developers for a really good reconnect system that acts fast and is the first thing you see when you log back in. There is the normal problem of these free to play games that it takes quite a while to get new ships/vehicles/tanks/ect. However, this game does its best to alleviate that problem. There are events where you can get ships, they have a free rotation where anyone can sail the ships that are in it, AND you can test drive every single ship in the game. Makes grinding for somethig less painful when you can sail it around on the test firing range occasionaly when you want to remind yourself why you want to get it. Graphics The game looks great even on my lemon wired to a potato. The partical effects look awesome and each ships has it's own looks when it fires its weapons. There are serveral very nice looking maps that get used for the sectors with capture points in them. Towering alien looking pylons floating in space, a field of icy asteroids, and others make a very nice backdrop and arena to fight in. I would really like a few more but I'm a huge nerd for space and just want more from other space games until I can get Elite Dangerous to work better on my computer. \"Technicals\" While I'm not much of a tech geek, I can tell you that you'll need atleast a moderately powerful computer to run this game at the graphics it deserves. The graphic designers obviously put a lot of love into the game and I think it shows. Sadly the game has started chrashing on me fairly regularly, but that may just be my computer so take that with a grain of salt. Conclusion I think the game is hovering around a 7.5/10 as it is right now for me. The graphics are great, the gameplay is not exceptional but it's fun enough to loose yourself in, the diversity among the ships is excellent, but I do think that some of the technical issues hold back my enjoyment. Although the fact that when It does crash my brain goes, \"Damn it, I have to get back in as fast as I can!\" speaks well of the game. If/when I get a better computer I'll come back to this review and if the issues have stopped, I'd probably bump up the score to an 8.5/10.", "appid": "310380", "steamid": "profiles/76561198056682412", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "33", "votes_funny": "4", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1524484800.0}

{"text": "It's so funny", "appid": "271590", "steamid": "profiles/76561198087323203", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "2", "votes_funny": "2", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1532260800.0}
{"text": "✔ 全体的に高品質なグラフィック ✔ 場面に緩急をつけるサウンド ✔ ビデオカメラを使ったユニークなギミック ✔ 迫真のボイスアクト ✔ Bloober Teamお得意の演出 ✔ ｸﾞｯﾎﾞｰｲ ✗ 分かりにくい導線 ✗ 直感的じゃないUI ✗ 終盤のゲームプレイ や で知られるBloober Teamによる新作。 同名の映画をベースに作られているが、ストーリーは完全に独立しているため映画を見ていなくても問題なし。 プレイ時間は初回プレイでおよそ5～6時間程度。 全体に漂う雰囲気や所々の演出はホラーとして秀逸だが、終始導線が分かりにくいのがゲームとしてのテンポを大きく削いでいると感じた。 また、終盤はとある理由 (詳しくは後ほど) からプレイしていて若干ストレスがたまった。 基本的に満遍なくパズルや収集要素、そして敵との遭遇パートが散りばめられているため、Bloober Teamの過去作の中でも、『Layers of Fear』より『Observer』の方に寄った作りとなっている。 結構視点の動きが多く視野も狭いため、3D酔いが激しい人にはあまりオススメできないかもしれない。 総合的な評価は点数で表せば といったところ。ギリおすすめ側。 ビジュアルや演出面で非常に優れているものの、ゲームとしてはプレイしていてやや不満が残る出来だった。 でも相棒の犬は可愛い。 以下詳細なレビュー。 この辺りは流石Bloober Team。 鬱蒼とした森や朽ちた建造物、グロテスクな死体等々、グラフィックに関しては他のインディーゲームと比較しても頭一つ抜けている。 サウンドも緩急がしっかりとしていて、危険が迫るような場面ではうまく緊張感を高めてくれる。 また、主人公エリスのボイスも情緒に富んでおり、不安や怒りといった感情がよく伝わってくるいい演技だった。 視点移動による場面の転換やループといったおなじみの演出も健在で、特に終盤ではこれらの要素が色濃く現れる。 一部の閉塞的な場面ではちょっと演出 (と視覚効果) が過剰気味で画面が見づらくなったりもしたが、全体的には非常によくできていると感じた。 本作では要所要所でビデオテープの再生/停止を活用したパズルを駆使して道を切り開くことになる。 このアイディアは中々斬新だとプレイしていて感心した。 パズルとしては適度な難易度で、不気味な世界観を演出する役割も同時に果たしていて面白かった。 で、パズルについては何ら不満はないのだが、プレイしていて不満というか拍子抜けだったのが、 である。 発売前、『ブレアウィッチ』の名やトレーラーから、てっきり暗視機能を使って視界を確保するのかなと思っていた。 さながら のように。 しかし実際にプレイしてみると視界確保の役割は懐中電灯が担っており、暗視機能は最後まで使い所のないおまけみたいなものだった。 そしてゲーム終盤ではなんだかレーダーじみた機能を発揮し、最終的にはライトと合体した。 なんか思ってたのと違う・・・。 本作をプレイしていてテンポの悪さを感じる点の1つがUIの操作だ。 コントローラーでの操作に最適化しているためか、はたまた没入感のためか、とにかく目的の機能に到達するまでにかかる操作回数が多い。 プレイ中、主人公の携帯端末にそこそこの頻度でメールが届くのだが、 サークルメニュー → 携帯を選択 → メール機能を選択 → 目的のメールを開く という工程を毎回行わなければならない。 また、後ろ2つについては目的の位置まで1個1個スクロールする必要があるため一段と面倒くさい。 もっとショートカットキーやマウス操作でサクサクと選択させてほしかった。 ゲームの終盤、手元のビデオカメラに映る敵の姿を確認しつつ、それにライトを当てないようにして進む必要があるのだが、このパートはストレスが溜まった。 カメラが画面右下にあり、ライトが当たらないよう視界も若干下向きで、とにかく意識も視点も下に集中セざるを得ないのが原因である。 ビデオカメラを構えてほぼ画面いっぱいに表示することもできるのだが、その状態だと移動速度が極端に落ちるため、結局そのパートは最後までほとんど画面右下しか見ていなかった。 おまけにこのパートでは敵に触れると即死である。 とはいってもゲームの難易度自体は全く高いわけではないので、視点の不自由ささえ我慢すれば問題ないとも言える。 自分はBloober Teamのホラーゲームが好きだったので発売後すぐに飛びついたが、正直フルプライスで買うのはあまりオススメしない。 それと1周が短いかわりに収集要素やら分岐やらがあって、実績を埋めようとすると結構疲れると思う。 ゲームのビジュアルに強く惹かれるタイプの人にオススメ。", "appid": "1092660", "steamid": "profiles/76561198068921313", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "32", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1577534400.0}

{"text": "One of less known adventure games set in a lush world reminiscent of Brian Jacques Redwall series, Inhrerit the Earth offers a classic point&click tale to enjoy with your pre-teen kids. A rich story is interwoven with light humor and puzzles that are not too dificult yet feel rewarding to complete. {"text": "Highly, highly recommended.  The one thing I regret in this new chapter of my life is the inability to devote as much time to video games as I used to. Which is why I require games that a) have a well-written, engaging story and b) shouldn't take up more than an hour. And that's where the problem arises. There are few games that fit into this criteria - What Never Was and Marie's Room are two excellent examples of the type of games that I dearly loved and enjoyed. Though I love the occasional all-nighter to enjoy a game like Firewatch, those are becoming less and less frequent.  Answer Knot fits perfectly into those two categories - it has a very gripping story (which gets increasingly tense as the game progresses) and can be played in less than an hour. {"text": "''Beep... Beep... Beep'' The sounds fills your ears as your sight is engulfed by nothing besides darkness, it seems you can't feel your arms and legs because you are unable to move them. Flashes of the events that led to this situation shows the ''time of your life'' in the middle of the street in your neighbourhood until... Well, let's just say you meet metal. Something isn't right... You hear screams, awful screams in the distance, it is familiar but you aren't sure who it is, your heart beat is getting stronger almost feeling like an earthquake, the only image carved in your unconscious is of simple three red lines... You have finally awaken received by a feminine scream, it seems you ''slept'' in a hospital, it doesn't matter, you stumble your way out of the room only to be greeted by this so called specialists running away while the cops bursts in the hallway with malevolent intentions towards you. Your empty face is slowly filled with Death's smile, final words? ''Just another week in Paradise...'' Following the events, our beloved Dude's attempt at exiting Paradise with deadly style was a total bust which ended him losing his best loyal companion and eleven years in coma due to a car accident. Even though karma is annoying, he enforces his nerves and decides to come back to rescue his beloved canine only to find the unspeakable apolocalypse that was once Paradise Falls while seeking help through the many factions instaled within. The question is, will you embark yourself in another epic adventure with our ethically wrong but still loved Dude throughout the wastes no matter the difficulty and no matter how much it'll cost to save Champ? With the cortesy of RWS, this DLC continues with the main game's open world and explicit violence with a pinch of dark humor, but better, for yet another adventure in the Postal Dude's life. The controls as always feels the same, slow on the mouse but perfect with the keyboard and yes that can be adjusted with its advanced option menu which until this day still impresses me, it even continues to feature console controller support for those who have an inner hate to play with keyboard and mouse. The objective changed but the obstacle remains, It is yet another week with more errands, most from the different factions you seek help in which ethics plays the same role during the completion of said errands and of course during the days of the week, you will unlock fragments of the town's map instead of having the main game's clean and complete version. The good ol' fifteen different styles of difficulties are back, ranging from the usual easiest ''Liebermode'' for those who like to bring chaos and the hardest ''Impossible'' for those who like to receive chaos into their lifes, it even brings the ''enhanced'' option as well enabling cheats when completing the ''Hestonworld'' difficulty. What about the level design? It may not be the best but still is impressive with its degraded and crumbled different areas of the city, because of the devastion, the areas have different microclimates, in other words, some parts of the city are snowing, others are raining, while an other is just sunny. Some new NPCs were introduced, with the presence of Zack Ward, with some gang members and some new enemies you will make throughout the gameplay and with this some new styles of clothing showing off to the appeals of ''RWS's styled'' apocalypse which baffled me at how much you can fit into this game in terms of its nature and not to forget, new weapons were added as well to satisfy your non orthodox methods of dealing with everyday problems, such as the revolver, the lever action shotgun and flashbang grenades as examples of such. I know what you're thinking and the funny thing is... Yes, it features new achievements, most of it are story based while the rest consists about the difficulty, your ethical self and speedrunning through the game. ''My name is Jesus'' was a bit difficult but with some tricks it just becomes easy and ''Harder than r/gonewild''  was more satisfying achieving than the rest, but that's just my opinion and not to be rude but I think ''Adderall4all'' is a bit too much and easily achievable... Some of the glitches that I mentioned in the main game's review are present such as bodies and limbs clipping through floors, walls or even get stuck in the ceiling and crashing after dying too much or an overload of bodies and the game can't process. One of the bugs that happened in my gameplays was with the attempt of achieving ''Adderall4all'' achievement, in which after completing monday, the loading screen doesn't show written ''tuesday'' and next won't play a cutscene and still keeps on ''monday'' and you have to do the errands all over again, this can be fixed, the problem is you will have to start a new game.   It caught me by surprised the fact this game has got a DLC, knowing the following of RWS's ''worst nightmare'', I still gave it a go and it was worth it. Comparing this to the main game, I would say it completes and provides a more enhanced experience with its offensive nature as well being unique in its own way and the developers did an astonishing job at the level design to make it more immersive and enjoyable to play. It really defines both the theme and the approach to the player. To be honest, it might be repetitive in some aspects and some parts might not what I was expecting as well as the fact that some people might complain about how downgraded and old the graphics might be but it still delivers a punch in the guts. To everybody who owns ''Postal 2'', I would definitely recommend for those who wants to continue to play or just isn't satisified with the main game's ending. I personally thank the RWS team for giving me a chance to decapitate Zack Ward... Score: 9.5/10", "appid": "360960", "steamid": "profiles/76561198823468150", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "49", "votes_funny": "3", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1581249600.0}

{"text": "bu oynu herkeze tavsiye ederim güzelll nice", "appid": "730", "steamid": "profiles/76561198401273432", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "2", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1500638400.0}
{"text": "I waited till i have finished the game with all the quests, the DLC included before writing a review. I think i first need to give the specs, for comparison :  - 32Gb Ram  - 2x 1080TI (one dedicated to games, one for the rest)  - i7-6700K 4Ghz  - 4K display  - Game on a SSD  - Win 10  - Latest drivers  - All settings to maximum TlDR : A very mixed experience 1.  Warning :   - I noticed that this game has a very strong anti-patriarchy tones in many dialogues. Even though Aloy was raised in a matriarchal society, she spouts a lot of lines that make me wonder how she was raised. Now, i don't really care about that. There are many ways to explain her behaviour and same for all the female characters' behaviour when they are talking. However, i do know that there are people that don't like being preached at in games and will want to avoid games with such content, so consider yourselves warned. 2. Performance :   - The performance of the game is rather nice. The game was running smoothly almost all the time. Had a few FPS drops here and there but nothing major or game breaking. From that side, it was surprisingly enjoyable. 3. Story :  - Fortunately, or unfortunately, depending on how you are looking at it, the story isn't anything new. It's a typical post-apocalyptic story where the main character has to save the day. I've seen/read/played these a lot so for me it's nothing new. That being said, since it's something quite usual, the game tells its story quite well and as such it's quite enjoyable to play trough. There was one plot-twist that i didn't expect and i was rather pleased with it. So on this side i'm feeling satisfied with it. 4. Graphics :  - I must say that the game's graphics are nothing to spit at, they are beautiful. Some places have really breathtaking vistas and exploring the world is enjoyable as such.  - That being said, this is standard for PC. Many games have graphics as good if not even better, though not the same performance to attain such graphics. One of them being Witcher 3, and another being Warframe (for the sake of comparing with a game of different kind). 5. Bugs :  - Setting aside the minor bugs that do not impact the game much, there is only one big major bug that everyone is talking about and might deter people from buying the game : the crashing bug. Now, i did have crashes, but although it was rather infuriating, especially when the game crashed in the middle of a cut scene or some other important game moment, it wasn't as bad as some people say it is. by reading the forums, i discovered that the crash \"timer\" can be reset by rebooting the PC, which i tried and it seems to work. Now, why do i consider this as not that bad? Well that is because i tried to play the game in sessions as long as possible and usually the game would crash after 10+ hours of play for me. So if you play in sessions of 2-4 hours, you might not even see a single crash. Also, it might be the game's way of telling you to take a break. Now, for the obligatory comparison :   - I played the Mass Effect, Assassin's Creed, and the Witcher series, so my opinion of this game was heavily influenced by it's predecessors.  - This game feels like an Assassin's Creed game mixed with The Witcher in a world similar to Mass Effect.   - The graphics are similar to The Witcher   - The exploration and platforming remind me of Assassin's Creed  - This game seems to have the main theme as a world destroyed by a race's greed (similar to Mass Effect's story). All in all, this game is not bad. If there were no crashes it would be more enjoyable, but it already is a lot. I am recommending this game because the game contains the DLC for free and this gives enough value to the game for the price they are asking. Most farming games is, your grandfather died, you got a new farm, boom, npcs leave you alone. But in this, you gotta talk to this person, and build X item, deliver a package the X npc, ect ect.  One thing i am extremely impressed about a ALPHA GAME! is that they already have VERY cute and VERY amazing events! prime exemple! during autumn, theres a haloween event in town, everyone is dressed up, you get new quests, and theres a SPOOooooOOooookyyyYyyy maze! 10/10 for such cuteness <3 Farming is EZ to learn, fishing is extremely simple, honestly, the hardest part about the game, is learning how to build things, and construct buildings, for certain buildings, you need X amount of X items to be considered whatever building yur makin. {"text": "This is a very cool little game to test out and play for the price.. to sum it up, its a hack and slash mixed with first person shooter mechanics with added abilties.. The story is very short as is now.. but their will be a full proper release. This is not a full game but more of a tease of what the game can be and how much more it will be when complete. Anybody who purchases it now will receive the full version when it is released.. It took me about 30-40 Mintues to complete my first run .. It has a very interesting theme to it and plenty of enemies for how small the game is.. The game itself is very fast paced, but you will find yourself doing a lot of kiting back and reloading as the enemies will take quite a lot of shots.. which is made up for it by your moblity, and the ability to combo your abilties... In a nut shell it feels like you are playing the Siren from borderlands 2, bubbling enemies then melting them down with bullets from three weapons. Pros: -Gorgeous visuals - Cute references - Nice gun play - Fast paced action - Interesting tease for a plot and id love to see more things expanded upon and explained -Cheap Cons: - It is very very short -the enemies can feel too spongey, maybe have more of them come at you once and to make up for it make it so they don't take as many bullets to kill.  -Grapple hook is very finicky and can kill motion, their are some parts where you can jump and ignore the grapple and others you cannot, so you will find yourself leaping, only for the grapple point not to work while your moving midair so you fall to your death, other times it will not fully pull you to the destination.  -Can use refinement over time and tweaks  TLDR: a surprisingly well polished game very short game that is displaying the mechanics and combat for a very reasonable price, that i would love too see where it goes.", "appid": "955050", "steamid": "profiles/76561198034856633", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "6", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1585310400.0}

{"text": "i love the game", "appid": "601430", "steamid": "profiles/76561198346482795", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "7", "votes_funny": "2", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1518868800.0}
{"text": "Juego de aventura que comienza con un asesinato en la ciudad de Nueva York. Hasta ahí nada fuera de lo común, la innovación viene cuando se te plantea la posibilidad de ir jugando de forma simultánea tanto con el asesino como con los dos policías encargados de investigar el crimen.  Fahrenheit narra la historia de Lucas Kane, que una noche de invierno entra misteriosamente en trance y asesina a un hombre en los servicios de una cafetería. Tyler Miles y Carla Valenti serán los encargados de desvelar los misterios que giran en torno a este extraño crimen y atrapar a su autor. Asumiendo el papel de Lucas entraremos en una sucesión sinfín de flashbacks y alucinaciones que nos transportarán tanto al pasado del protagonista, reviviendo su infancia, como a realidades alternativas surgidas del cerebro de este. Una trama en la que se darán lugar rituales sectarios e insólitos sucesos por doquier, en donde deberemos iniciar un camino de aventuras y desventuras hasta descubrir por qué un día despertamos portando un cuchillo con las manos ensangrentadas y un cadáver a nuestros pies. Viviremos la historia alternativamente desde los puntos de vista de Lucas, Tyler y Carla, afectando cada decisión que tomemos en las futuras opciones que se nos abrirán al controlar a los otros personajes. Markus Kane, hermano de nuestro protagonista principal, en determinado momento también hará acto de presencia y sus intervenciones serán vitales para llegar a descubrir qué es lo que está sucediendo. La estructura del juego se dividirá en bloques o escenas a modo de capítulos, como si de una película o una novela se tratase, en donde al final de cada acto alternaremos la perspectiva de los sucesos, eligiendo con quien queremos continuar a partir de ese momento.  Los personajes principales gozan de una enorme profundidad y cada uno tiene una personalidad muy definida. Interaccionar con otras personas o con los propios objetos del escenario, aunque en ocasiones no sea necesario para avanzar en la trama, nos ayudará a conocer a Lucas, Carla y Tyler, así como a comprenderlos mejor.  El desarrollo de la urdimbre tendrá instantes en los que para descansar de la constante tensión a la que estaremos sometidos, se nos permitirá realizar multitud de minijuegos en diversas situaciones, como tocar la guitarra, leer, boxear, etc, afectando todos ellos a nuestro estado de ánimo.  Cuidar la moral de nuestro personaje será de vital importancia, ya que si llega a cero, Lucas optará por el suicidio. De igual forma, cuando manejemos a Carla, la cual padece claustrofobia, tendremos que procurar que respire para que conserve la calma en momentos en los cuales debamos estar en lugares cerrados. La cámara en muchas ocasiones nos mostrará cambios de plano de forma muy cinematográfica, al más puro estilo hollywoodiense, y efectos como el de pantalla dividida o “multivista”, mostrándonos varias situaciones que suceden al mismo tiempo, tal como pudo verse en la serie “24”.  Debido precisamente a los cambios de cámara automáticos, el control del personaje puede volverse en algunos puntos un tanto brusco, aunque por lo general no tendremos dificultades en el manejo, estando bastante adecuado al transcurso de los acontecimientos en todo momento, combinando ratón y teclado para realizar las acciones, pero de forma muy eficaz. Los gráficos no suponen ninguna novedad en el mundo de los videojuegos, pero sí que son los suficientemente correctos como para proveer al título de un diseño visual que cumple de forma sobrada para la época de la que data el juego original (2005). Soberbia ambientación en cada uno de los escenarios que recorreremos, tanto interiores como exteriores. Sentiremos angustia y desasosiego en el papel de asesinos y desconcierto como detectives. Cuidados paisajes nevados estarán siempre presentes en el desarrollo y la escenografía queda encuadrada dentro del argumento a la perfección. Las animaciones podrían haberse pulido algo más. Las faciales quizá no tengan toda la expresividad que cabría esperar para un título semejante, así como las corporales, las cuales presentan movimientos un tanto robóticos en determinados momentos. No obstante, en ningún momento se le resta por ello realismo a los acontecimientos. El sonido de este título es un punto a favor, contando con una banda sonora creada por Angelo Badalamenti, compositor de algunas películas de éxito en la gran pantalla. El doblaje de las voces es bastante bueno, a pesar de observarse en algunas ocasiones una ligera falta de sincronización con los labios de los personajes. Como cómputo global, simplemente decir que es una espectacular aventura gráfica con elementos de acción, con un guión original y muy interesante, o como sus creadores, Quantic Dream, prefieren definirlo, “una película interactiva”.  Innovador, distinto a lo que nos tienen acostumbrados la mayoría de títulos de este género, con un guión digno de la gran pantalla y que sin duda, merece ser jugado por cualquier aficionado al género.", "appid": "312840", "steamid": "profiles/76561198064577411", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "26", "votes_funny": "3", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1498392000.0}

{"text": "First of all, let me preface this review by declaring that racing games are not my strength or favorite and I am an imbecile when it comes to car mechanics & terminology. I can barely change the oil in my own car so when it comes or horsepower, torque etc... I am clueless. With all that being said I actually enjoyed this game much more than I thought I would! While I found myself dead last in most of the races it was still fun. Controls were easier to pick up than I was anticipating and I was drifting in no time. As you would expect, there is an emphasis on drift mechanics with scoring multiplyers applied on how well you do it. Graphics are good with crisp, sharp outlines to the vehicles. {"text": "Em \"Tacoma\", você é Amy, a encarregada de descobrir o que aconteceu com a nave e a tripulação da Estação Espacial Tacoma. Você está a serviço da empresa responsável pela estação e tem como objetivo a recuperação dos dados dos tripulantes e de ODIN, a AI da nave.  Esse é um jogo com poucos comandos, tornando a mecânica fácil e dispensando tutoriais ou teclas de atalho. Ele mistura exploração com point and click pois você precisa caminhar pelos compartimentos da nave através de pistas, de chaves e códigos para abrir portas e da história dos tripulantes enquanto interage com os objetos de cada ambiente. Pontos positivos: -Trilha sonora -Gráficos -História rica, bem escrita e amarrada -Personagens contagiantes -Mecânica fácil -Jogo leve -Personagens LGBTs Pontos negativos/O que pode melhorar: -História muito curta -A jogabilidade poderia ser ampliada para dar mais liberdade ao player -A fotografia poderia receber mais atenção dos DEs durante o curso da história Eu queria esse jogo há algum tempo e, por sorte, o ganhei em um sorteio no SG. Baixei assim que possível e terminei o jogo em uma sentada. \"Tacoma\" é viciante e envolvente. Te faz perder a noção do tempo e te deixa angustiada com cada descoberta e uma trilha sonora de te fazer borrar as calças. Não sei quanto as outras pessoas, mas eu, definitivamente, irei jogá-lo de novo. Com calma. Para apreciar melhor a história e encontrar detalhes que por acaso passaram despercebidos na primeira vez. {"text": "+ Various game modes + Provisional cost mechanics simplify the act of deck-building + Animations are sharp & satisfying + Lengthy, but more than adequate tutorial that is actually helpful without being overbearing or overcomplicated + Card animations & artwork are fantastic + One can advance well enough as a free player, & the game manages to avoid falling into pay-to-win territory + Runs well with no issues, & feels generally streamlined + Cross-platform support with Android & iOS devices + Steady progression & good pacing when advancing + Surprising amount of customization options & unlockables: boards, profile avatars, avatar borders, titles, card backs, etc. + Features a \"GG\" (Good Game) button after each match, & pressing it gives your opponent a small resource boost for their time; I've found that 9/10 players use the GG button after every match, & it felt like a welcome mechanic that helped to foster good sportsmanship + Taunts during matches; there are only 6 options, but they aren't overbearing, & I felt this was a great system to have in place of an easily abused chat feature + More factions & a much more in-depth game than that found in The Witcher 3; overall, GWENT has been completely reworked & deepened, making it a vastly superior game + One can click around on the game board & it rewards the player with little \"puff\" animations & satisfying sound effects; completely meaningless, but strangely soothing & helps to take a lot of the frustration out of waiting for the other player to make their move + Move timers to ensure that games don't get bogged down in indecision +/- Game boards only have two rows (melee & ranged) instead of the third (seige) row in TW3; {"text": "I have NEVER ever felt so many different, strong emotions while playing a game. Happiness, sadness, surprise, anger, hurt, betrayal, satisfaction, wonder, joy, sorrow, disappointment, amusement.......all of these came at least once at some point in this game...and a few 2 or 3 times. Never has a game affected me or made me feel so many different things at once. This game is fantastic, and can easily be played in a few hours/a day. Simply put: It's not so much as an actual game as it is an interactive story. The player does very little by way of doing actions of choice, and mostly just clicks around to advance the storyline. There are moments of gameplay where the game gives you free movement to \"feel\" like you're doing something (by way of collecting stuff), but mostly this game is one of the games VERY VERY strong and deep on STORY and CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT and less on actually doing things yourself. I'd very strongly suggest it for anyone wanting to waste a few hours. Have a box of tissues ready, though...and be prepared to feel a plethora of different emotions that ranges from being happy to feeling conned even. {"text": "* An expertly crafted story with lots of twists and turns. * All choices have consequences in typical Game of Thrones fashion. * Familiar places visited such as Castle Black, The Red Keep, & King's Landing. * Solid voice acting. * Excellent lore, and background story. It is Game of Thrones after all. * Outstanding musical performance. * A story that draws you in very quickly, and keeps you invested from around maybe an hour in to the very end. * The combat. There's no getting around it being poorly designed. * The camera is too zoomed in. * Graphics didn't age particularly well. * The stats and (perhaps especially) skill system aren't well explained, making it easy to make mistakes with the selections. You can turn the combat difficulty down to easy if you find it too horrible (and let's face it, it is). That makes it bearable enough so that you can just focus on the story. The game starts out quite bland, and I was quickly turned off by the quirky gameplay, and the truly bad combat. It wasn't more than 15 minutes before I had my first urge to quit and just write it off as a mistake. However, I stuck with it for a while, and after an hour had come and gone, the annoyance had lessened as the story drew me in a bit more, and so I decided to play on for a while longer before making any final decisions on whether to continue or quit altogether. After 2 hours the story had drawn me in to such a degree that the combat no longer annoyed or even irritated me enough for it to matter.  26½ game hours later, and I'm done with what was an outstanding experience with a downright fantastic story. Speaking of the story, it's split between 2 people. It starts with you playing as Mors - a former noble knight who took the black and is now a 15 year veteran of the Night's Watch - who receives a letter from the Hand of the King asking him to track down a woman hiding in a nearby town, and hand her over to a knight who accompanies you on this mission for further safekeeping. There is no more information than that, but you soon find out that all is not as it seems, and you're left fighting for your very life while trying to protect this mysterious woman.  When we aren't busy fighting for our survival as Mors, we follow the story of Alester. A nobleman of a lesser house, who upon returning to Westeros after his 14 years self-imposed exile find that things haven't exactly turned out well for the house since he left. On top of that his family has not yet forgiven him for leaving all those years ago, and in fact, they all blame him for the death of his father, as he was never the same after he left. It is not made easier by the fact that Alester also turned away from the common Westeros religion known as the Faith of the Seven, and is  now a devoted Red Priest (like Lady Melisandre from the books/series) worshipping R'hllor, the Lord of Light. You soon discover your house is in dire straits, and it's up to you to save it from ruin, and so in typical Game of Thrones fashion you become a pawn of the greater powers while you scramble to reclaim your house, and save your sister from having to marry your psychopatic half-brother in order to retain the family name and land. The game does a very nice job of splitting off the story into segments where half the time you'll be dealing with problems seen from the perspective of a lowly soldier, and the other half you'll be trying to survive the political maneuvering of the noble houses, which is just as deadly. The two stories inevitably collide, and we end up following our pair of heroes as they try to survive and protect those they hold dear.  Along the way you'll meet a few familiar people, should you have read the books, or seen the series, such as Cersei Lannister (The Queen), Lord Varys (The Spymaster), and Joer Mormont (The Lord Commander) who you'll recognize as the faces are skinned after the actors playing them in the series, and they've lent their talented voices to the game as well. However, you won't be lost at any time should you not have seen the show or read the books, as the story takes place starting around half a year prior to the start of the books/series, so the story is quite original but does tie in quite beautifully with the story we know. When you're not fighting for your life, you're left to explore locations as they open up, and during this exploration part of the game, Alester has you utilizing his special priestly powers to find hidden objects, doors, and loot, while Mors, being a  skinchanger, can slip into the mind of your dog and track smells, explore hidden areas, and even sneak up on enemies and kill them by ripping open their throats to avoid combat. The dog is also very useful in combat, where it can do everything from disarming an opponent to scaring them, and giving you extra stamina regeneration.  Both characters have unique fighting styles, with Mors being more of a traditional type of fighter, and Alester potentially being a formidible water dancer (like Syrio Forel from the books/series) who doesn't need heavy armor to stay alive, but instead relies on his ability to dodge while augmenting his offensive capabilities by calling on his priestly powers of fire to wreak some real havoc and set enemies ablaze.  This game ended up being such a pleasant surprise for me. It has an incredibly well crafted story, and yet some of the weakest gameplay to support it, with combat being just plain bad. Yet none of that matters, because the story all makes up for it.  I bought this game almost exactly a year ago from this review, and it is just one of those games that I always found excuses not to play it, and so it just sat there for a year. However, I gave it a shot a few days ago, and it was one of the most engrossing games I've played in recent times, and now that it's over I find myself a little sad that there's no sequel.  I thoroughly recommend this game if you want to play something with a strong story, and you're willing to \"suffer\" through not so great gameplay for a while. You won't regret it.", "appid": "208730", "steamid": "profiles/76561198012349483", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "37", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1486468800.0}

{"text": "Palindrome Syndrome is an escape the room game with a twist. You awake in a space station and work puzzles to open up one room after another in search of who you are and why you are there. The environment is detailed but the only items you can interact with are puzzles and related clues. This is a fairly short game (took me about 3 hours) with a lot of very easy puzzles. I would describe it as a 'casual' game in that the puzzles require straight forward logic and do not require strategic or conceptual thinking. They reminded me of puzzles one would find in a logic puzzle book (matching patterns, completing sequences, ordering items based on relative statements, etc.). There are a number of lever puzzles but I solved these through a few random clicks rather than having to understand which buttons were controlling which switches.  Overall, this is a worthy puzzle game but I found it was more of a marathon than an exciting journey. The story is well done and I did get caught by surprise when I got to the ending. I'd recommend it to those looking for a relaxing puzzler that will keep you busy but not tax your brain.", "appid": "1374290", "steamid": "profiles/76561198200161774", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "10", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1604145600.0}
{"text": "Drake Hollows is a very cute game and a mix of various genres. As the protagonist we got teleported to another world where we need to care about the cute Drakes. It is a building sim as it is required to create some buildings for them. The game is also a resource management game as we need to feed and entertain them. Additionally, it is required to explore the world for resources, fight enemies and defend the camp from raids so Drake Hollows ...the character creation. You can be female/male and you can choose any possible color for skin, eyes, hair. ...the Drakes. They are sooo cute and they interact with every single building in some weird, cute way. They are just awesome. ...the challenging gameplay. Fighting multiple enemies during an ambush is very challenging, but if the game is not scaling up enemies when multiple players on the map then the coop could be a bit boring. ...the graphic. The game looks very nice (well, unless you like only realistic graphic game instead of the cartoony one) ...the music. The decent soundtracks have a good chemistry together with the graphic and other parts of the game so it is easy to get pulled in and forget about the time. ...that the game is available in both single player and co-op. ...that you can find many-many outfits for your character. Fortunately, this game isn’t from koei tecmo or a similar company so these are included in the game instead selling each of it as dlc on a paid game. ...the nonexistent voice acting. 30€ game and no voice acting/narration? I know, there aren’t many speaking NPCs, but there should be one for the crow, cat etc. Come on! ...that i got stuck on rocks many times. ...that some quality of life features are missing. Like filtering items based on their type when moving items from inventory to the stahs or when selling items. The other one was that there is only 1! Button for all utility items. It is very annoying to go through 8 or more items when I need the healing item during combat. ...that some hints weren't exactly clear. I had some difficulties figuring out how to connect electricity to other buildings, how to repair buildings, etc. ...that I can’t repair my weapon once it loses its durability. ...the limited amount of enemy types. There are exactly 4, and 1 boss. You can find all of them already in the first 1-2 hours, 10-12 hours later, already at the end of 2nd chapter, still no new enemy type. ...that the game starts to be repetitive after 12-14 hours. In the second chapter, the same buildings, environment, just the season are different and there are still no new enemies. I liked this game and I will continue to play it until finished. Is it worth 30$-€? Well, if you have XBOX game pass, then play it there. This game is included in that one.  Combat is ok and because of the mixing multiple genres into one game there are many things to do and all of those implement properly, without bugs or problems.  As I know there is an upcoming sandbox mode with randomized map so this will offer some replay value.  It is a bit ruined by the too many integrated genres. I would explore an island and constantly called back to defend the camp from raids or by having too low amount of food/water in camp.  Nice looking game. . Quite nice soundtracks and environmental sound effects.  Single player feels sometimes a bit too hard. If the game does not scale difficulty based on the number of players then multiplayer with 3-4 would be boring. Perfection time: ~25-35h. There are 2 MP achievements and for one you need 3 other players. That is not the challenging part tho. While 1 walkthrough is enough, getting all notes is very hard. Not just because the whole world of the campaign randomly generated, note locations are randoms, but it is hard because these notes bugged sometimes. Map shows for some island that you can find there 1 collectible, while i found there 2, some shows 3 but only 2 there so not just hard to find all, but can't even believe to the map. The other achievements are easy during a regular, nonspeedrun playthrough. {"text": "酩酊状態の怪力軟体人間によるオープンワールドパズルアクションゲーム。 プレイヤーキャラは見た目動きとも可愛いですが意外に力持ち、自分と同じ大きさの岩や木箱、樽なども軽々？と運べます。特筆すべきはどんな高さから落ちてもOKな丈夫な体、関節がないかのように自由自在に動く手足、そして垂直な壁でも片手一つでぶら下がれる脅威の吸着力を持つ掌です。ただしカナヅチなのと虚空に落ちると流石に助からないのでご用心。これらの能力を駆使し、あちこちに散らばるアイテムやギミックを利用しながらワールドを脱出していきます。日本語は非対応ですが平易な英語によるチュートリアルがついてるので操作自体は直に慣れると思います。問題はヨタヨタとしたその動き、コミカルで可愛い動きではありますが仲々思い通りに動いてくれません。決して操作性が悪いわけではないですがもどかしさを楽しめるかどうか、若干人を選ぶゲームではあります。一部で人気の某外科医ゲー、茶会ゲー、義手ゲーと同列のゲームといえます。 自分は約１０時間、何とか楽しめる範囲内でクリアまで行きましたが、途中何度か「あ”あ”あ”あ”あ”～」となる場面もありました。慣れてくると体を揺すってあとちょっとの高さに手をかけて無理やりよじ登ったり、（おそらく）本来の解法でないやりかたでショートカットしたりと色々見えてくることもあります。ギミックも多岐にわたり船（筏からタンカーまで）、トラックやフォークリフト、投石機、ターザンロープにジップライン等々と満載で飽きさせない工夫が凝らされています。実績解除も単にクリアするだけではなくかなりの数になり、それなりに挑戦のしがいがあります。ただ全実績解除を目指すとなるともはや修行のレベルとなりそうで自分はほぼ断念しております^^;。 以上のように全面的にオススメとはいかないところですが価格的にもさほど高価ではなく、セール時であれば十分オススメできる作品です。", "appid": "477160", "steamid": "profiles/76561198082254484", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "28", "votes_funny": "4", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1487073600.0}

{"text": "Здравствуйте, сегодня я хотел бы рассказать о игре Rust, немного о игре: Игра создана инди-студией FacePunch, ранее вы могли слышать от еще одной игре этой компании, да... да, я говорю об легендарной игре Garry's Mod. В начале игры, вы появляетесь в один штанах и ваша цель - выжить любой ценой. Карта в Rust, представляет собой остров, на котором одна замкнутая дорога, этот остров - огромный! И что само интересно - в игре нету карты, что бы узнать где ты находишься или же где твой дом. При начале игры вам даётся камень и факел, для начала игры эти предметы вам очень помогут. Ночью, лучше не гулять по улице, а запереться в своём уютном доме. Зомби в игре, очень сильные, так что без оружия, лучше к ним не лезьте. В игре есть еще одна особенность, при выходе из игры, персонаж не пропадает, он просто засыпает. Пока вы оффлайн, вас могут просто обокрасть, поэтому выходя из игры, заходите в свой уютный дом. В игре можно строить от обычных деревянных домиков до огромных домов размером в 9 этажей.  Пора подвести итоги: игра очень интересна в плане выживания, строительства. Не скучна, даже после месяца игры, вы захотите играть в неё дальше. Огромная карта, на которой хватит места ВСЕМ! Графика в игре, также на высоте. Советую всем поиграть в этот шедевр. Жаль, что так мало действительно хороших игр, как эта.", "appid": "252490", "steamid": "profiles/76561198248902918", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1480075200.0}
{"text": "Зашел значит в игру в первый раз... красиво, интересно... побегал... первый бой, так, ага, хедшоты тут не канают...хм на 10+ лвлах зашел в ТЗ, чуть позше вышел и не заходил... {"text": "Я играю во много “старых” игр, и не понаслышке знаю, что даже самые хорошие игры могут не пройти “проверку временем”. Не только из-за графики - кривое управление или просто морально устаревший игровой процесс могут испортить впечатления, особенно если вы не испытываете к игре ностальгических чувств. Но хоть такие неприятные разочарования случаются, я встречал достаточно примеров, когда вместо морально устаревшего артефакта прошлого я находил игры, которые с легкостью затыкают за пояс даже последние новинки. И одним из таких бессмертных шедевров является Dead Space. В свое время я пропустил эту игру, потому что я не большой фанат хорроров, да и обзоры на нее в игрожурах были в целом сдержанные. Так вот, может в 2008ом Dead Space действительно была не настолько впечатляющей, но сейчас она ощущается как глоток свежего воздуха. В ней столько шикарных идей и задумок буквально во всем, от игрового процесса и сюжета до интерфейса и звука... Трудно поверить что такую игру выпустила ЕА, которая по сей день больше заинтересована в своем конвейере спортсимов, чем в оригинальных идеях. В Dead Space столько всего хорошего, что я прям даже не знаю, с чего начать. Пожалуй, начну с интерфейса - с того, чему большинство современных проектов уделяют внимание в последнюю очередь. Не знаю как вы, но я играю в игры чтобы погрузиться в атмосферу их виртуальных миров - но все эти миникарты, счетчики патронов и прочие списки заданий вечно лезут в глаза, а без них часто играть становится затруднительно. Разработчики Dead Space решили эту проблему на редкость элегантно - они сделали весь интерфейс частью игрового мира. О состоянии здоровья главного героя можно узнать по индикатору на его спине, а всевозможные окна интерфейса вроде инвентаря и карты просто висят в воздухе. И это относится не только к протагонисту, но и к другим персонажам - у них тоже есть эти индикаторы здоровья, а окна интерфейсов также появляются перед ними и игрок может увидеть их со стороны. Такие вот казалось бы небольшие детали значительно добавляют к атмосфере и достоверности мира игры, и, честно говоря, очень жаль, что большинство разработчиков не пытаются сделать нечто подобное в своих проектах. На атмосферу в Dead Space работает буквально всё - графика, звук, постановка сцен, все это создает мрачное, депрессивное ощущение постоянной опасности и тревоги. Звук в этой игре является ее вторым важнейшим достижением - все эти шорохи и крики, то и дело разрывающие звенящую тишину, с легкостью доведут до икоты слабонервных игроков. А уж эти голоса и шепот, которые вскоре начинают чудиться главному герою, только еще больше наведут вас на мысли, что вы потихоньку сходите с ума. Разработчики проделали отличную работу в том, чтобы игрок с головой окунулся в мир Dead Space - хотя это явно не тот мир, частью которого вы захотели бы стать. По сюжету, главный герой, обычный инженер по имени Айзек Кларк, прибывает на космический корабль Ишимура в составе команды спасателей. На Ишимуре произошел какой-то инцидент, поэтому вас отправили туда на случай, если понадобится техническая поддержка, а не для боевых действий. Ремонтом заниматься действительно придется часто - параллельно пытаясь выжить на корабле, захваченном агрессивной инопланетной формой жизни, которая использует мертвые тела чтобы размножаться. Монстров в игре очень много, и они бывают разных типов, от обычных мутантов с лезвиями вместо кистей рук до огромных “танков” с непробиваемым “фронтом”. Вас будут атаковать со всех сторон, включая с воздуха и вертикальных поверхностей, и в большинстве случаев наваливаться на вас будут всем скопом. Выжить в таких условиях трудно, но можно - в арсенале героя есть 7 видов оружия на любой вкус, из которых с собой таскать можно только 4 пушки. У каждого оружия есть альтернативная атака и они пригодятся против разных типов врагов. Еще в вашем распоряжении есть две “способности” - вы можете “замораживать” врагов стазисом и бросать в них предметы с помощью местного аналога гравипушки из Half-Life 2. Эти навыки также используются в решении головоломок и для преодоления препятствий. В большинстве случаев, чтобы уничтожить врага, от игрока требуется не просто всадить в него как можно больше пуль, а отрезать их конечности. Процесс расчленения отлично анимирован и открывает простор для стратегического подхода, например быстрым врагам лучше сначала отстрелить ноги, а потом уже добить. Бои в Dead Space очень агрессивные и постоянно держат в напряжении, поэтому игра вынуждает использовать все доступные для выживания средства. Даже самые крутые сюжетные игры редко могут похвастаться таким достоинством, как хорошая режиссура, но разработчики Dead Space и тут выложились на полную катушку. Постановка сцен и боев тут сделана на высочайшем уровне, в игре постоянно что-то происходит и ей есть чем удивить игрока. Темп повествования также выдержан идеально, игра грамотно чередует напряженные моменты с эпизодами вроде матча в баскетбол с нулевой гравитацией. Мало какие игры могут так умело подать себя и свой мир, как это делает Dead Space - внимательный игрок также узнает много интересных деталей из окружения и декораций. 12-14 часов, которые уходят на прохождение этой игры, пролетают незаметно. Поругать Dead Space есть за что, но это не критичные недоработки. При таком агрессивном экшне игре явно не достает кнопки для мгновенного разворота на 180 градусов. Еще мне не очень понравилось то, что разработчики сделали главного героя немым - это просто выглядит странно, что при всей происходящей вокруг чертовщине ему нечего сказать. Да, Айзек кричит от испуга и боли, но вне боя он позволяет себе проявить эмоции только во время концовки. Возможно, разработчики пытались сделать так, чтобы игрокам было проще отождествлять себя с главным героем, но это не очень работает, потому что во многих ситуациях я бы поступил по другому, а не так как мне было навязано по сюжету. Если бы я нашел свою возлюбленную, которую так долго искал на этом проклятом корабле, то я бы первым делом попытался обнять ее, а не молча стоял рядом как ни в чем ни бывало. Такой диссонанс выглядит еще более странным, учитывая что все записи в журнале заданий ведутся от имени Айзека, то есть у него есть свои мысли по поводу происходящего, но он почему-то не выражает их в самой игре. Так что да, я не большой фанат решения сделать из него немого протагониста, это больше повредило логичности повествования чем помогло в погружении игрока в атмосферу игры. Но в целом, Dead Space стала для меня чертовски приятным сюрпризом. Я ожидал увидеть обычный западный клон Resident Evil, а в итоге получил одну из лучших сюжетных игр, в которые я когда-либо играл. Dead Space это как хорошо выдержанное вино, его вкус начинаешь особо ценить на фоне тех бездушных, безвкусных суррогатов, которыми являются многие современные ААА проекты. Это очень тщательно выверенная и продуманная до мелочей игра с напряженной атмосферой, увлекательным игровым процессом и великолепным звуком. Если вы также как и я в свое время пропустили эту игру, то я настоятельно рекомендую восполнить этот пробел как можно скорее, потому что Dead Space обязательна к ознакомлению всем, кто любит хорошие сюжетные игры. Жаль что эта серия в итоге загнулась в типичной для ЕА манере, но я слышал что вторая часть как минимум вышла хорошей, так что она у меня определенно в списке игр что я собираюсь пройти в ближайшем будущем.", "appid": "17470", "steamid": "profiles/76561198083550415", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "117", "votes_funny": "6", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1580040000.0}

{"text": "Cures Ebola", "appid": "550", "steamid": "profiles/76561198080076628", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1414929600.0}
{"text": "Třetí pokračování úspěšné série hry Blitzkrieg od ruského studia Nival je opravdu impozantní. Tato realtimová strategie z doby druhé světové války naplňuje hráče nostalgickým dojmem těchto časů. Milovníci druhé světové války si zde přijdou opravdu na své. Celá hra se drží historie tak, jak byla psána. Blitzkrieg 3 disponuje singleplayerovou kampaní, ale také i zajímavým kooperačním systémem ve hrách hráči proti hráčům. Existuje zde i Boris, AI oponent, proti kterému si můžete zahrát a vyhrát potencionální odměnu. Sama hra Vám nabízí, abyste si proti tomuto počítačovému oponentovi zahráli a dostali za to odměnu ve formě nových vojáků.   Na začátku hry máte možnost vybrat si národ, za který se pokusíte změnit běh druhé světové války. Příjemně překvapivý je fakt, že národy a jejich vojáci jsou plně nadabováni dle rodného jazyka. Hra sama o sobě má nečekaně dlouhý tréning, který připravuje hráče na určitou, byť jen zdánlivě nebezpečnou, situaci během boje.  Nedílnou součástí hry Blitzkrieg 3 je taktická mapa, která vás provází po celou dobu kampaně. V ní si můžete určovat vaše budoucí tahy, do jaké šarvátky se zapojíte, a kde budete bojovat příště. Kampaň využívá několika typů misí. Některé jsou prakticky pouze šarvátky, ke kterým došlo ve druhé světové válce, ale nemají vliv na dění historie, a poté zde jsou velké historické bitvy. U každé z nich je uveden stručný popis pro případné neznalce dané bitvy. Mise, které nebyly důležité pro děj války, si můžete opakovat, kolikrát chcete a nehledě na to, jestli jste ji vyhráli, nebo prohráli. Ani generálové ve hře nejsou žádní vymyšlení chlapci, ale jsou to přímo honorovaní generálové, kteří v těchto bitvách opravdu byli. Po celou dobu kampaně přidáváte zkušenostní body svému generálovi a ten je schopen Vám později při vyšších bitevních zkušenostech nabídnout různá vylepšení.  Nedílnou součástí každého národa je dílna, která zkoumá technologie, které dokáží posílit vaši armádu. Za každou vyhranou bitvu obdržíte určitý počet výzkumných bodů, které pak můžete rozdělit do čtyř kategorií vylepšení. Před každou misí si volíte pomocí bodové hranice své začáteční jednotky. Ty však můžete posílit plněním úkolu v dané bitvě a přivoláním posil, které jsou mnohdy velmi vítány. Mnohdy dokončujete misi s posledními třemi vojáky, u kterých se modlíte, ať je nic nezastřelí. Bohužel bodů na přivolání posil také není mnoho, takže je lepší rozvažovat, zda povolat do boje tank, nebo pěchotní družstvo.  Ve hře lze využít možnosti taktické pauzy a lze si tak pečlivě promyslet svůj příští tah. Bohužel se bojové prostředí nedá kompletně využít ve prospěch vojáků. Nelze se krýt za předměty, které pro to nebyly stanoveny. Takže vojáci se odmítají krýt za stromy a keři, raději si lehnou uprostřed bojiště a doufají, že se jim nic nestane.  Ovládání vojenské techniky je do jisté míry příjemné. Tanky umí couvat na pozici, provádějí taktické přesuny pomocí kouřových clon. Ale zformovat tanky do řady dle toho, jak chcete, bez využití ovládání jedné jednotky prostě nelze.  Blitzkrieg 3 má ale stále velký potenciál, který se týká možností variace jednotek a jejich kombinace. Příjemný je fakt, že jednotky jsou vybalancované a jejich skutečný potenciál se dá plně využít. Hra dává naprostou volnost fantazii ohledně strategických postupů a volnost po celé mapě, což je ovšem někdy na škodu, protože vést boje na třech frontách zároveň dá hráčově mozku zabrat. Hra Vás zabaví na dlouhé hodiny a atmosféra druhé světové války je naprosto dokonalá. Za tým CzechLP dávám hře Blitzkrieg 3 osm bodů z deseti možných. {"text": "Garakowa -Restore the World- is a 60-minute long animated film directed by Masashi Ishihama and produced by A-1 Pictures. Frankly, what made me watch this film was its relatively short length, so I'll describe its positive and negative aspects. Positive: (+) The art and animation I guess this is the section most of the budget went to. The backgrounds of this anime were simply gorgeous. The colors and details were amazing. The animation was also smooth and high quality. I didn't especially like the character designs, mostly because I dislike anime with little girls, but objectively speaking, there was nothing wrong with that either. (+) The soundtrack The soundtrack of this anime was comprised mostly of piano pieces, which fit well in most of the scenes. Overall, I liked the soundtrack a lot. (+) The concept Despite the flawed execution, the concept of this anime was pretty good. The events happen in a virtual world, where the main characters, who are anti-virus programs, delete corrupt files. Basically, imagine if the agents in Matrix were cute magical girls. I have to admit, the idea wasn't bad at all, but it could have been better, for reasons which I am gonna explain below. Negative: (-) Everything else Apart from the great art and soundtrack, as well as the concept, the movie fails at pretty much every other department. Despite its short 1-hour length, this movie feels like 2 hours due to the slow pacing and constant information dumping. The characters speak endlessly about the details of their world, but without a proper explanation, everything feels like pseudo- scientific mumbo jumbo. The characters remain mostly under-developed, so you don't really care what happens to them. The action scenes were short, and despite the brilliant animation, you don't really know what's happening, apart from the obvious ugly virus monster vs cute anti- virus girl. {"text": "I love the dinosaurs iam happy with the way the creatures damage and health and other stats on other creatures I like how they are adding new creatures too  This is a fun game you can play online with friends very fun.", "appid": "376210", "steamid": "profiles/76561198341107947", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1490443200.0}
{"text": "Cerca de tres años dio comienzo el lanzamiento de Witch it como un Early Access, un videojuego que mostraba su estructura principal y que se iniciaba con un estado más que aceptable, evolucionando y añadiendo novedades y correcciones. Sin embargo, fue en el pasado mes de octubre, cuando el estudio alemán Barrell Roll Games junto con el editor Daedalic Entertainment, decidieron dar un rumbo diferente a este videojuego con una edición finalizada pese a seguir recibiendo diversas actualizaciones. Con la situación que vivimos en la actualidad y con todos los videojuegos que hay en el mercado, el modo cooperativo y/o multijugador es el más demandado, y Witch it nos viene a presentar un PvP cooperativo de lo más novedoso y original: la caza de brujas.   Witch it es un juego muy sencillo, prácticamente inmediato y con una rapidez a la hora de introducirnos en su mundo y de poder rejugar con partidas de tan solo 4 minutos. Está claro los roles que vamos a poder manejar, ya que se pondrán cara a cara aquellas facciones que habitualmente siempre han estado enfrentadas: por un lado el cazador de brujas y por otro la propia bruja. Su vitalidad y personalidad será algo que les caracteriza, mientras que los cazadores serán típicos granjeros, las brujas serán señoras con poderes mágicos que harán todo lo posible por esconderse mientras sueltan una risa malvada. Este conflicto y que sin duda es la esencia del videojuego, se divide en diversos modos de juego para poder disfrutar sin parar y siempre en multijugador online. El modo estándar es el Hide & Seek, el típico escondite con dos fases: la fase de ocultación y la fase de búsqueda. En estas partidas podrán asignarnos de manera aleatoria un rol, en el caso de la bruja tendremos que pasar desapercibidas pudiendo convertirnos en cualquier objeto del entorno para mimetizarnos y que de esa manera los cazadores no nos encuentren. Y en el caso de que seamos descubiertas pasaremos al bando contrario hasta que acabemos con la última bruja o se acabe el tiempo y haya sobrevivido. También está el modo Mobification, muy similar al anterior y dónde con el transcurso del tiempo se volverá más intenso y complicado en cuanto todo se llene de cazadores. Por último está el modo de Fill a Pot, que trata de llenar un caldero por las brujas, mientras que los cazadores lo intentarán impedir a toda costa.   Para ayudar al equilibrio de cada clase, cada bando tendrá unas habilidades especiales por defecto y siempre determinadas por su barra de maná o de resistencia, eso sí, serán dos habilidades únicamente y se podrán cambiar previamente al inicio de la partida, eligiendo con estrategia conforme el mapa que nos haya tocado. Por ejemplo, las brujas podrán usar una habilidad para soltar una especie de muñeco diabólico y que salte a la cabeza del cazador y así este pierda visibilidad, y en cambio los cazadores, pueden lanzar gallos para que alarmen si hay o no brujas en un rango de 6 metros.   Con respecto a los mapas, a diferencia del Early Access dónde estaba en pleno desarrollo, han sabido añadir más mapeados diferentes y con temáticas y decorados muy distintos para variar en su jugabilidad y que no se sienta tan repetitivo. Justo al finalizar una partida, el sistema de juego nos permitirá a todos los jugadores elegir entre cuatro mapas y el que reciba el mayor número de votos será el elegido en la próxima partida. Además, también existirá un sistema de experiencia (que siempre sube igual y no depende de nuestra actuación en partida), el cual nos otorgará llegar a más de 200 de nivel y podremos desbloquear algunas opciones de personalización del personaje, como son: accesorios, ropa, incluso la apariencia física.   Witch it arroja un estilo gráfico que podría considerarse un poco anticuado, de hecho puede llegar a mostrar cierta nostalgia con aquellos juegos de la PlayStation 2, siendo algo simples y con unas texturas basadas principalmente en los píxeles anchos. Sin embargo, toda esta simpleza que demuestra, resuelta ser muy satisfactoria y visualmente muy bien hecha al estilo de los dibujos animados, pese a tener pocos detalles. Además de no declarar ningún problema crítico importante que pueda llegar a molestar a los jugadores. Con respecto a la banda sonora, si es cierto que aquella que nos encontraremos nada más abrir el juego en el menú inicial, es la típica música orientada a un mundo repleto de aquelarres y que otorga misterio en eventos como Halloween, pero dentro de la partida la música cojea bastante. Aquella que nos acompañe en las partidas serán realmente aburridas, pudiendo incluso usar nosotros mismos nuestras propias canciones que encaje con la temática, el drama y el suspense.   En conclusión, Witch it demuestra ser un videojuego que tras varios años en desarrollo y con una comunidad alrededor bastante grande, se convierte en un juego realmente divertido. En la actualidad es poco conocido, pero sin duda cabe destacar las decenas de horas que puede otorgarnos su jugabilidad como cazador y como bruja, además de ser muy ágil y rápido a la hora de introducirnos en una nueva partida. Su sistema de progresión con la subida de niveles y la demostración de una biblioteca llena de skins, nos animarán a seguir jugando una vez más. Si dudas en adquirir o no este juego, te recomiendo que no lo pienses más y le des una oportunidad para jugarlo de vez en cuando. Nota Final: 7/10 🌍➡", "appid": "559650", "steamid": "profiles/76561198130032493", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "19", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1605096000.0}

{"text": "I recommend The Isle to anyone who is into immersive experiences and open to a more introspective mood in a game. This game is good at what it wants to achieve, but that definitely is not a setting that will work for everyone.  You will have to put a lot of your own investment and energy into figuring out what the game is for you personally, because at the moment it doesn't offer very much in what comes to direct hands-on game mechanics. There is definitely going to be many hours you spend walking or sitting hidden in a bush doing nothing else than listening, and that can be a frustrating experience if it's not one that suits you. Personally I think the sometimes more, sometimes less subtle meta-game that exists in The Isle is brilliant. Relying heavily on sound design is a very interesting aspect of the game. Learning to recognize different animal sounds from one another is a rewarding part of the journey, as it has direct gameplay implications. There is a proper sense of 'easy to pick up but hard to master' which is a good building block for any satisfying game. All of the dinosaurs play differently from one another, and that helps in keeping each session fresh. Any frustration that I've had with controlling the characters is only due to \"designed frustration\" as every animal has been balanced to have strengths and weaknesses. Character motions are fluid and respond well and have a nice sense of conveying the weight of your creature. Dying can sometimes be very upsetting, but it's a necessary aspect of the gameplay to add to the sense of gravity and risk to what you're doing. Only having meaningful character deaths is going to make the moment to moment gameplay satisfying. However, I can easily see how feeling like losing hours of progression can be too much for some. This is one of the aspects of the game where you need to be very self-aware in knowing what you're in for and if the experience itself is enough to make up for the inevitable 'game reset' you will suffer as your creature dies. I personally think it's a fine way to approach the game design, as it creates a very natural ecological fluctuation on a server. Quality wise I don't have much to complain about. The graphics are beautiful, the animations are easy to read and also play into being able to recognize each character from one another. I've not encountered many bugs, and the few that I have aren't game breaking. Occasionally you may find a spot in the map where you get stuck, but in my experience this is rare. There's some roughness around the edges but nothing that would take away from the game experience in any meaningful way. If you're up for soaking in the atmosphere, The Isle is great.", "appid": "376210", "steamid": "profiles/76561197977071031", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1572868800.0}

{"text": "这游戏的节奏，我很喜欢： 我这个玩下去的存档，是新建的第三个；它和MHW截然不同的是，MHW一个骚鸟，毒妖鸟，那么大一片森林，追追打打好半天，伤害数值还有个位数，可能会让人觉得很烦，给劝退了；本作反而是节奏太快了，进图1分钟不到，就结束了被召回，地图也没什么探索的必要，会给人一种，还没开始呢，还不尽兴呢，这就完了的感觉吗(⊙_⊙) 每次任务回来，都要找每个NPC对话一下，不然可能会错过一些可有可无的人物信息。 镰刀和重月，是让我觉得很酷的两个武器，平时别的作品也看不到；就算能看到，也多半是那种高不成低不就的尴尬地位。但在本作里，这两种武器，输出和性能都挺高的，非常好用ヾ(◍°∇°◍)ﾉﾞ 动作系统和MHW有所区别，本作的角色们非常灵活，战斗起来可以说是眼花缭乱；被击飞了能在0.5秒内恢复并且继续追击；除了特定技能，玩家受到多少次伤害都不会眩晕；但不知为何，有着和MHW一样古怪的锁定，虽然一般没人用，但锁定这个设计真是莫名其妙，也是一转视角被锁定的目标就会一直变换。@.@ 武器变形也是一大亮点，玩之前还问朋友，“你记不记得，有个动漫作品，主角们靠着特殊的武器对抗特别的怪物，然后那个武器能变形什么的，还可以通过噬咬怪物来变强。”翻了翻阅历，好像没有，后来才发现，其实就是噬神者来的。 人物的建模和动画的差距还是挺大的，但幸好在战斗中，这些都可以忽略不计，只是在过场的时候，那油腻的配色，非常的出戏。 随着武器制作，技能插件，新敌人的陆续出现，游戏变得有意思了起来OWO 任务可以说得上是重复，但是随着和同样的敌人反复作战，对它们的了解程度也越来越高，武器用得越来越顺手，格挡的时机也越来越准确，就像MHW一样，是个玩家舆角色一同成长的游戏୧(๑•̀◡•́๑)૭ 2个地方让我对这游戏的好感陡然提升，一处是第一次遇到“灰域种”的荒神，就好比第一次和古龙种作战吧，那BGM，太燃嘞٩(๑>◡<๑)۶；另一处是可与其他玩家联机讨伐的突袭任务，那么多人一起讨伐荒神，心中莫名地激动~ 然后会发现，前期那么几十秒就回归的任务，其实是一种教程的概念；到后面，一个任务大概是2-4分钟，掐表的话，其实和在黑魂3里打boss的感觉差不多；作者的意图，似乎就是把它做成一个BOSS RUSH的游戏，玩家不用考虑其他的，进图就在boss面前，和形形色色的boss对战，便是这游戏最大的乐趣了~ 中期还会获得一个女儿一般的NPC，非常贴心又可爱，还会嘤嘤嘤，尤其是那句，“En en en en engage~”Σ(⊙▽⊙”a 质量很不错的游戏，玩得很开心(*^▽^*)，这份开心，感觉不亚于当初热衷玩MHW的时候，换句话说，即便是玩过很久MHW嘞，本作仍能勾起不少兴趣~ DLC更新也算得上良心，现在已经全部更新完，可以入坑嘞~ 全成就的难度也不大。 剧情嘛，正如我标题所言的，我觉得是一场无意义的战争，兴许制作方的意图是反战思想。 P.S. 每次了结了敌人，可以用捕食攻击咬一口，获得些许材料。。。这一点，还是我直到R7才发现QAQ", "appid": "899440", "steamid": "profiles/76561198298470536", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "18", "votes_funny": "3", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1604145600.0}

It's very cool! 4. Also, liked the story and the amount of endings (haven't reached any of them yet, though). I like that there are missable notes that can reveal more about the story or characters.  5. As an overcompletionist, I love the achievements. For me personally, hiding mechanics were the hardest to understand. I spend a lot of time in the tutorial trying to figure out what I was doing wrong. Turned out that I have to be mindful of slashes and type \"close door n\\\". That made me thinking that the game would benefit a lot if the tutorial would have examples of the stuff you can write (like not in the brackets like they are now but in a text so even dumb-dumbs like me would figure it out). Something like that: \"you can also hide in the game. In order to do that close the door behind you. For example, the command \"close the door s\\\" would close a particular door on your south but the rest would stay open, be mindful of that.\" I know that this suggestion might seem funny but I really had a hard time and more examples would be very helpful. {"text": "It's not everyone's type of game. There's no multiplayer and to be honest you'd be better off playing it with an xbox 360 controller or similar controller with the emulator mod (ask if you need the link). I've met and have heard from others in the forums that using keyboard and mouse, you eventually get used to it and the only difficulty is in the driving. I actually used both, shooting with keyboard/mouse and fighting and driving the xbox controller.  Regardless of price (I did buy it discounted through some key re-seller friends, but it wasn't at this price nor were the dlc I got with it) I totally enjoyed this great game. It's like every John Woo film and a lot of Bruce Lee and Jackie Chan films put into story mode. There's even a dlc called Zodiac Tornament that is pretty much the movie Enter the Dragon where you go to an island tournament with all the different stlyed fighters and of course have to beat the evil organiser of the tournament, classic Hong Kong movie stuff to be had all round. Story wise, you are an ex Triad gang member gone to the States and returns to Hong Kong assigned the task of getting into a gang that you have ties to from your youth and a score to settle with one of the leaders of another faction of the Triad gang Sun On Yee. You have to deal with all the politics and oblivious Police dept. issues as well as the gut wrenching ethical dilemas of being a cop posing as gangster to people you eventually end up respecting and caring for as almost family. If you are time poor and just want to experience the story and action unabated you can get this game complete with all the upgrades and rip through the game almost too quickly but have all the bling and weapons at the game start. Кроме того, игра, скорее, сосредоточена не на Хлое, а на Рейчел, что оказалось логичным вариантом в конечном итоге. Хлою мы уже знаем, а вот Рейчел - почти нет. Тут и характер Рейчел раскрывается, и взаимоотношения с Хлоей, и драму завезли и   Я бы даже сказал, что Deck Nine выжали из идеи приквела практически все, что можно было. В игровых издательствах модно эту игру ругать: мол, вот оригинальная часть была крутой, а тут - поделка с иллюзией выбора, которая  Ну, прежде всего, надо помнить, что оригинальная часть тоже была исключительно рельсовой, и кому в голову пришло, будто там есть реальный выбор, я, признаться, затрудняюсь. Выбора там штуки две на всю игру, однако почему-то игрожур упорно распростраяет мнение о том, какая вариативная оригинальная Life is Strange. Полный бред. В вопросе вариативности приквел ничуть не лучше и не хуже оригинальной игры. Касаемо того, что   Ну так и в оригинальной игре об этом чуть ли не прямым текстом говорилось. Понимаю, что это еще больше добавляет рельсовости игре, но это особенность приквела: нам уже известны некоторые стороны взаимоотношений, особенности характеров персонажей. И как бы не хотели создатели аль игроки изменить это устоявшееся представление, без ущерба для логики повествования очень тяжело сделать. Поэтому данное решение вполне очевидно и оправданно. Как итог: мне понравилось, прошел с удовольствием, по вечерам после работы уставшим поиграть - самое то. Если Вам нравится оригинал, то, скорее всего, понравится и приквел. Если Вам оригинал показался скучным и слишком глупо подростковым, то приквел Вашего мнения не изменит и тратить свое время на него не стоит.", "appid": "554620", "steamid": "profiles/76561198036636016", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "4", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1520769600.0}

{"text": "I first saw this played by Many A True Nerd and was instantly interested. Quarantine Circular sets out to provide a unique story about humanity's first contact with alien species and does so spectacularly, and for me, lasted about two hours, although I suspect that everyone should expect the game to last that long. It is of course a game mostly about reading the conversation between multiple people and an alien named Gabriel, with a 3D environment as a backdrop to provide a setpiece for the story to take place in. Most of your focus will be on the dialogue, but it is enjoyable to peer past it and watch the movements and reactions of the crew and Gabriel, even if they are a little limited. Like I said, it's mostly about reading.  Obviously if you are only interested in games that provide a constant moving experience and things to do, this isn't a game for you. It's a slower, more methodical experience, that leaves you asking some pretty hard hitting questions about what to do in the situation you're presented with. That also means multiple different outcomes and endings thanks to your decisions for better or worse.  Overall, Quarantine Circular provided an enjoyable experience and an interesting world to be placed in. It left me wondering if I made the right choices and what could have been done differently. I recommend it to anyone who enjoys an experience where their decisions matter and for those that enjoy heavily story-driven games, as that is pretty much the entirety of this one.  Short, sweet, and unique. I found absolutely zero drawbacks and coupled with the presentation and soundtrack, I easily give Quarantine Circular a 10/10", "appid": "853500", "steamid": "profiles/76561198107558252", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1561809600.0}

{"text": "《Alwa's Awakening，奧瓦的覺醒》是一款 8bit 像素風格的 Metroidvania 類型的遊戲，遊戲中玩家扮演著一位被召喚而來的女法師，為了拯救奧瓦大陸踏上征途。遊戲設計整體非常復古，不論畫面還是音樂都刻意模仿任天堂時代的遊戲，以少量像素和顏色要刻畫出畫面反而是另一種藝術，各處場景都獨具特色，也有專屬配樂，喜歡像素復古風的玩家千萬不要錯過。 說到遊戲系統，它有完整的 Metroidvania 該有的各種要素，不過別出心裁，以往大部分的 Metroidvania 各種能力獲得不外乎就是二段跳、攀牆、滑行或破壞特定牆壁地板的能力之類的，讓玩家能通過之前過不去的地方，但這款遊戲完全沒有這些能力，沒有！真的！那你一定好奇，沒有這些要怎麼玩？因為遊戲設定玩家是法師，所以能力是各種法術，玩家必須拿到特定的魔法寶石後才能使用，遊戲主要有三種魔法，磚塊、泡泡、閃電，磚塊能抵禦敵人遠程攻擊，當成墊腳的踏板，後期還能當成浮木之類的東西，而泡泡能向上漂浮，使玩家往更高的地方移動，初期泡泡會破，後期可以漂到高空，閃電則能做為遠程攻擊手段，或是能破開特定的門、觸動機關之類的，所以，玩家必須善用這些能力來戰鬥和探索，遊戲的關卡設計非常機智，大多需要解謎，有些地方甚至需要三種能力的搭配才過得了，這大概是我看過解謎成分最高的 Metroidvania。 至於關卡設計，它的關卡算是非常自由，拿到能力後幾乎可以亂跑，不一定要先打王，可以先去拿別的的魔法，當然，有些地方要靠後期能力才到得了，有些則是要靠解謎，甚至有設計 speedrun 的隱藏路線，所以有很多隱藏的路徑，等著玩家發掘。另外，遊戲中的彩蛋還不少，必須從各地的 NPC 或石板訊息來發現。 總之這是一款有趣的遊戲，一玩就停不了，想一直探索下去，推薦給喜歡 Metroidvania、解謎、8bit 像素風、微操作的玩家。最後要一提，遊戲關卡難度會越來越高，自覺手殘可能要斟酌一下，有些是配合解謎需要一氣呵成的操作。 需要中文的可以下載我製作的中文化使用：", "appid": "549260", "steamid": "profiles/76561198077423566", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "31", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1526472000.0}
