{"text": "Necesito los demás capitulos T-T", "appid": "319630", "steamid": "profiles/76561198125338479", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1451908800.0}
{"text": "Death is a great teacher. Failure in Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is, as it always has been for this series, the greatest way to learn where you should have gone, what you shouldn't have done, and how you could have done better. Counter-Strike players spend a lot of time learning -- consequently, they are always getting better. Growth is an important factor in Global Offensive, especially if you're coming into Counter-Strike fresh or after a sabbatical. This is an extremely hardcore, skill-based first-person shooter, and it forces you to think differently than other modern shooters. If you’re a Call of Duty player, you’re going to need to change your play style to succeed here. Counter-Strike also tries developing into something new here as well, despite doing little to push itself beyond what it’s always done best. Global Offensive modifies old maps to keep veterans on their toes, and introduces official new modes that encourage different play styles for the first time in almost 15 years. For the uninitiated, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is a small-scale, team-based first-person shooter with permanent death. When a counter-terrorist kills a terrorist planting explosives in a classic Defusal match, or a CT escort swallows a sniper round in Hostage Rescue, the victim is dead for good and doesn't respawn until the next round. As such, players on both sides must exercise skill and care. The bomb objective, meanwhile, gives everyone a purpose. Of course matches end when everyone on a team is dead, but a clever and coordinated terrorist team will give the CTs the slip, plant their bomb, and protect the bomb site. Between rounds, everyone spends earned cash on better gear and guns, and the cycle continues. Pieces of the Counter-Strike formula are dated at this point, but the superb heart and soul of Global Offensive is timeless. Teams are small, guns are lethal, and rounds are short. There's an addictive just-one-more-round quality to it, because there's a constant desire to do better than last time, to earn a satisfying kill, or to win in a new way. Call of Duty and Battlefield vets will wonder why they can't sprint to escape enemy fire or look down the iron sights to improve aim; Counter-Strike players will feel like they walked into their redecorated home. Certain map redesigns will catch hardcore fans off guard, but the changes are for the best -- the underpass choke point in de_dust, for instance, has a new escape route. Even in the face of genre evolution, Global Offensive doesn’t care to adapt. CSGO is so dedicated to Counter-Strike's aging ideals despite market and trend changes that it brute-forces its way to success. Part of what makes it such an engaging competitive game is that killing in Global Offensive requires a wholly different skill set than other shooters. Everyone is limited to what they have and can see, with little room for character modification or on-the-fly advantages. Running and gunning is a useless play style, even if you've bought a helmet and kevlar that round, to the point that someone standing still is more likely to score the kill. Walking, crouching, or standing are your best bets to reduce the inaccurate spray of machine-gun fire. Consequently, killing in Global Offensive feels good. There's a sickening sensation to dropping someone dead because you know they're not coming back. It's also satisfying knowing you used limited resources to play smarter than your victim. If players aren't watching corners, providing covering fire, or using smoke grenades and flashbangs, they're more likely to take a headshot from a more delicate and patient triggerman. The desire to experience that distinct feeling is a strong motivator to keep playing, even when you're getting steamrolled by an obviously better team. If you've played Counter-Strike before, Global Offensive probably sounds a whole lot like Counter-Strike. Like Counter-Strike: Source before it, Global Offensive exists simply to modernize the look of the classic competitive shooter, while doing little to disrupt the core form and function. At the same time, it does enough to color outside the lines of tradition to justify your time and effort. Fire is one of the most interesting new combat variables. Molotov cocktails and incendiary grenades either roast groups of guys or force them in another direction. Flames are a useful distraction or scare tactic, too. They're particularly useful during Demolition matches, which focus the fight at a single bomb site rather than giving terrorists two to pick between. The new and modified maps in this mode aren't as big as classic Counter-Strike arenas – entire sections have been cut off to direct teams toward a central location – but their thoughtful design is as intricate as ever. The Lake map is a standout -- there's a wide open yet densely populated yard around the bomb site, which is inside a sizable lakeside home with plenty of vantage points and hiding spots. To separate Demolition from Defusal, players can't buy between rounds. Instead, it takes a cue from the other new mode, Arms Race, in which each kill unlocks another weapon instantly. The better you do, the more you have to switch up the way you play, and because Demolition is so fast you'll need to be quick on your feet. Unlike other game types, Arms Race allows for respawns. It's the most chaotic and care-free mode in Global Offensive, with players throwing caution to the wind for the sake of climbing the kill ladder as quickly as possible. It's a shame there are only two maps in Arms Race -- a problem that will more likely persist on consoles than PC. If you have the option, playing the PC version is unquestionably the best way to experience Counter-Strike: Global Offensive. Mods, mouse and keyboard, and the usual PC-only options are better than the ports. Plus, Valve is much better about long-term PC support -- it abandoned Team Fortress 2 on consoles, and Portal 2's level editor was PC exclusive. If you prefer to play on consoles, Global Offensive is the same great game.", "appid": "730", "steamid": "profiles/76561199063522743", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1591272000.0}

{"text": "Firewatch es, a mi modo de ver, un juego sobre las relaciones humanas. Plantea, primero, la relación del protagonista con su pareja a través de diálogos cortos y directos, a modo de introducción, pero suficientes para crear el marco personal de ambos; y después nos obsequia desarrollando la relación entre el protagonista con su jefa, trazando unos personajes completamente creíbles, muy bien construidos, desarrollados y doblados. Algunos de sus diálogos no tienen desperdicio. También se esbozan un par más de relaciones personales en el juego con otros personajes, que no se desarrollan tanto (o casi nada) pero que sirven para añadir aún más profundidad y realismo al entorno narrativo. Но дальше будут спойлеры,поэтому остановлюсь на этом описании сюжета. Ничего сложного в игре нет. Мы просто ходим по дому,читаем записки,осматриваем предметы и детально изучаем новые комнаты.Радует,что игра нас никуда не торопит. Изучай в свое удовольствие. Для меня это был интересный процесс. Но тут у всех разные вкусы (спорить о них как минимум глупо). Звуки в игре Прекрасны! Гроза гремит время от времени. В самом начале думала,что это хоррор. Было реально немножко страшно. Атмосфера в доме на высоте:чувствуется одиночество и пустота дома,хотя прекрасно видно,что дом еще недавно был живым. Если быть внимательным можно заметить множество мелочей,которые согреют вам душу) В одной комнате не мало секретов.  История понрваится далеко не каждому, но атмосфера уюта и разглядывание предметов и всяких мелочей очень порадовало. Домашняя,ламповая,неторопливая игра. Не жалею потраченных денег . {"text": "Terraria — игра о свободе. Она сознательно не задает никаких рамок, кроме временных: ясный день скоро сменяется темной ночью, откуда-то вылезают зомби и плотоядные летающие глаза, поэтому к вечеру лучше обзавестись убежищем. Чтобы его построить, необходимо добывать строительные материалы — рубить в округе деревья и выкапывать из-под земли камень. Когда первый грубый домишко закончен (строите его вы сами, буквально выкладывая по кирпичику), выясняется, что есть еще куча дел, которые нужно сделать. Например, собрать из древесины верстак, на котором можно создавать новые инструменты, оружие и отделочные материалы. Или поставить в доме наковальню, чтобы хилый деревянный меч поменять на стальное жало с булатными разводами, а на плечи надеть какой-никакой доспех. Ведь мир вокруг отнюдь не безопасен — и в штольнях, и наверху вас постоянно прессуют монстры.. Но с меча и первого доспеха все только начинается, потому что удачливого героя в глубинах Terraria ждут самые экзотические вещи. Так, вы можете найти меч, который призывает на головы врагов звездопад. А потом собрать работающий бластер. А потом (чего уж стесняться) — самую настоящую световую саблю. {"text": "Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut is identical to the original Deus Ex: Human Revolution game with the addition of the \"Missing Link\" DLC integrated into it, rather than as a standalone game. The story serves as an indirect prequel to the original Deus Ex, as it doesn't deal with the Denton brothers; rather, it takes place in 2027, during the height of human augmentation, and tells a story, full of conspiracies, in the usual Deus Ex fashion. It follows Adam Jensen, an ex-cop turned head of security at Sarif Industries, an augmentation company, who becomes augmented himself after his workplace is attacked. Following these events, he starts following a trail of clues left by attackers, to discover a large conspiracy involving powerful people. The art of the game is fantastic for it's time. It still follows suit to the style of the original Deus ex but with improvements towards the overall look and feel. The overall game atmosphere   be a little dark at times, but is still great to pair with the mood and story of the game. The soundtrack is fantastic, working well alongside the graphics and gameplay of the game. Sound effects being very well done. In tense moments, the soundtrack provides a good balance of stress/rush. Surprisingly there hasn't been a significant change in the base gameplay from the original, aside from making everything much more UI intuitive and user friendly.  The player can choose to be like a ghost and pass through each mission unseen/undetected, or can opt to go for an aggressive guns blazing playstyle. Either way, the choice is up to the player and the game will react to your choice of actions.  The game is good, absolutely no doubt about that. The controls/graphics can look and feel clunky at times, but overall this game provides a very good balance of options and difficulty, while also providing a decent amount of replayability for any achievement hunters and perfectionist gamers out there.   - - - - - - - - - -      - Great soundtrack and art - A comfortable UI with user friendly controls - Partial controller support if desired - Great storyline - Tricky but interesting boss fights     - Very weak storyline and extremely linear gameplay - Not truely open world unfortunately - Occasional clunkyness of the game", "appid": "238010", "steamid": "profiles/76561198043781049", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "2", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1530792000.0}

{"text": "MEGAA", "appid": "488210", "steamid": "profiles/76561198107634418", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1595160000.0}
{"text": "Как подпортить репутацию консольного шедевра? Очень легко, забей на то, что у игры нет региональной защиты, портируй его на ПК , наплевав на его технические косяки. Вуаля! Мы получаем \"Смешанные\" отзывы. Хуже перенесённой игры только недоработанная игра. Однако, разработчики выкатили 3 патча, которые в целом пофиксили основные проблемы игры, но неприятный осадок, в виде поднявшейся в 3 раза цены, всё-таки остался. Да уж...стартанула игра очень плохо и я чуть не забросил её прохождение, но по мере выхода патчей ситуация улучшалась и моё мнение изменилось в лучшую сторону. Поэтому, давайте поговорим о самой игре... Игра знакомит нас с маленькой девочкой по имени Элой, она и её наставник (по факту он ей как отец) живут в мире пережившем, по неизвестным причинам, апокалипсис и вернувшемся в первобытное состояние. Казалось бы, первая, консольная версия Far Cry: Primal? Нееет...В игре есть то, что далеко от первобытного мира, то что является особенностью её сеттинга - это роботы, не пойми откуда взявшиеся и заселившие каждый уголок игрового мира. Все они смертельно опасны и очень агрессивны, даже не смотря на то, что внешне напоминают некоторых животных, которые по своей природе не трогают людей. Итак, наш наставник, которого зовут Раст должен обучить Элой азам выживания в этом суровом мире. Ещё прибавляет проблем социальный статус наших героев, они Изгои. Однако, в один прекрасный день Элой узнаёт, что есть некий ритуал Инициации, который поможет ей вырваться из этого порочного круга презрения со стороны окружающих её людей. Но, в столь долгожданный день происходит, то, что меняет  жизнь Элой навсегда - череда событий, которая показывает нам, что предназначение Элой куда большее, чем просто вырваться из касты Изгоев, гораздо большее чем пройти Инициацию. Почему произошёл апокалипсис? Откуда взялись эти бесчисленные  машины и кто их создатели? Кто  родители главной героини? На эти и многие другие вопросы Элой найдёт ответы в огромном, некогда запретном для неё мире, в развалинах некогда процветавшей цивилизации. Путешествие начинается! Так как игра позиционирует себя как  Экшн/РПГ, то она подразумевает открытый мир, а мы все знаем что такое РПГ с открытым миром, это много лута, эпичные замесы с врагами, торговцы, прокачка персонажа и оружие, в общем исследование мира во всей его красе. В игре есть чем заняться, помимо очень интересного сюжета, нам предлагают множество побочных заданий, которые может и не такие интересные, а порой и построены по избитым клише, но всё-таки нужные в плане изучения настоящего и прошлого мира и людей населявших/населяющих его. Так же можно отточить своих навыки борьбы с машинами, в Охотничьих угодьях.  Касательно самой боевой системы, её тут считай нет, я имею в виду,  что тут нет блоков парирований и контратак, битва с машинами, грубо говоря, сводится к стрельбе из дальнобойных орудий (лука, рогатки, пращи), ударам копья на ближних дистанциях и перекатам от атак врага. Ещё игра предлагает стелс- прохождение битв: прячемся в высокой траве, расставляем ловушки, или бьём враждебных NPC бесшумными атаками. Лично я предпочитал \"решать все вопросы\" по старинке, с шумом и взрывами :D Кстати, интересно, что навыки в древе прокачки, наиболее располагают к прохождению игры в стелс- режиме, нежели в открытую, скорее всего это помощь тем, кто играет на хардкоре.  Весь мир поделен на 3 биома: лесной, пустынный и зимний. Так вот, все они выглядят просто потрясающе и выдают настолько сочную картинку, насколько это возможно. Фоторежим даёт возможность наделать кучу красивейших скринов, с разными фильтрами и ракурсами. В HZD природа пестрит своей красотой уж поверьте, наверное красивее только в Ghost of Tsushima. Эта игра создана для прохождения в 4k разрешении, а с треками, которые сопровождают нас всё время вообще как-будто играешь в фильм. Я считаю, что помимо визуала, музыка создаёт здесь львиную долю атмосферы.  Технические косяки, допущенные при релизе в Стиме, конкретно напортили впечатление о HZD  всем игрокам. Покупать эту игру за фулл прайс или ждать скидки решать вам, в настоящий момент игра очень даже  играбельна, но требует довольно мощного железа чтобы держать более-менее стабильный кадр. Если вы изначально настроены негативно к этой игре, в свете последних событий, то сразу советую вам проходить мимо, удовольствия скорее всего вы не получите. Лично я очень доволен, что наконец она появилась на ПК и можно пройти её самому. Купить игру, чтобы придирчиво выискивать косяки - это не моё. В любой игре они есть, любые разработчики когда-нибудь ошибаются :)", "appid": "1151640", "steamid": "profiles/76561198168383699", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "22", "votes_funny": "2", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1599134400.0}

{"text": "Pierwszy Ghost Recon był dla mnie dużym zaskoczeniem. Zastanawiałem się czy ta gra powinna taka być. Pomimo iż grę oceniam pozytywnie to jednak mam pewne zastrzeżenia ale o tym później. Na początek fabuła [mogą być spojlery] : Rok 2008. W Rosji mają miejsce niepokoje społeczne. Ultra nacjonaliści którzy przejeli władze w kraju chcą odbudować Związek Radziecki. USA wysyła jednostkę specjalnych żołnierzy o nazwie Duchy aby ci powstrzymali nacjonalistów. Fabuła niczego sobie. Jest jaka jest. Wspominałem o zastrzeżeniach. Gra sama w sobie nie jest śmieciem. Jak na 2003 rok to było nieźle nie oszukujmy się. Ale są pewne rzeczy które zasługują na rozpiskę. Poziom trudności. Pomimo iż na poziomach ginie się po pare razy to jednak same poziomy wypadają bardzo dobrze. Przed misją wybieramy swoich żołnierzy do poszczególnych drużyn i gramy. Poziomy są średniej wielksości ale są fajne. To naprawdę jest duży plus ale poziom trudności jest bardziej odczuwalny i potrafi zepsuć zabawę. Grę jako jedną z nie wielu przeszedłem za pomocą komend. {"text": "Эта игра конечно, замечательная, но... ...игра еще очень сырая. Кругом наблюдаются баги и всяческие приколы на подобии проваливаливания под текстуры и тому подобного. Это конечно не плохо, но порой бывает критично, например: в игре после сна бывает такой баг, что у вас застывает время и вы не можете никак продвинуться далее и исправить это без внедрения в файлы игры. Игра вышла совсем недавно и я уверен, что такие разработчики как Обсидиан способны сделать из этой игры конфетку с таким финансированием как у Майкрософт.  Эта игра простое выживание стилистикой очень похожа на Raft и механикой как у The Forest, НО эту игру выделяет одна важная вещь - сеттинг. Эта игра про подростков, что были уменьшены в размерах которые пытаются выяснить, что же с ними произошло. Игра довольно сложная, потому что по началу вы будете повсеместно сталкиваться с муравьями, что будут постоянно воровать у вас ресурсы и разрушать ваши постройки дабы добраться до них. Игра очень коротка на данный момент, ведь это всего бета и в будущем я надеюсь на лучшее. Игра безусловно стоит своих денег, дарит множество эмоций своими багами и возможностью изучать этот странный, маленький, но такой большой мир.", "appid": "962130", "steamid": "profiles/76561198151329051", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "2", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1596283200.0}

{"text": "garip bi oyun", "appid": "227300", "steamid": "profiles/76561198370127928", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1596369600.0}
{"text": "Streets Of Rage 4 is an arcade action beat 'em up and the next installment of the much beloved classic franchise Streets Of Rage developed by Dotemu/Guard Crush Games/Lizardcube and published by Dotemu/Yooreka Studio (Greater China). Adam Hunter, Axel Stone and Blaze Fielding return along with a new cast of characters to once again clean up the mean crime ridden streets of Wood Oak City in this fantastic and long awaited sequel to one of the most adored fighting game franchises of all time. After years of peace a new crime syndicate lead by children of the dreaded Mr. X, known as the Y twins, have seized control of the city for nefarious purposes and now it's up to you to stop them by any means necessary. So prepare for some bare knuckle brawling of epic proportions as this title shifts a tried and true genre into the next generation of gaming. Superb visuals aside, the fighting is definitely the best aspect of this long awaited title. To start, you can select from a number of characters to play including Axel Stone, Blaze Fielding, Adam Hunter, Floyd Iraia and Cherry Hunter. They all have different fighting styles and characteristics such as speed, stamina and power. It's up to you to decide which of them fits your particular style of play. One of the nice things about this game is learning a characters fighting style and using it to the best of your ability as you dish out justice on the streets of Wood Oak City. All of the characters are quite varied so playing a game from start to finish with each one of them is a unique experience on it's own merits. The controls in this title are simple and intuitive so jumping from one character to another is not a jarring experience when it comes to remembering their abilities. Speaking of control, I think most people would agree that games like this are best played with a control pad so there's an option screen which lists all the moves for the fighters abilities and you can remap the buttons if you see fit but there is also an option to use a keyboard and mouse if you prefer.  This is a brawler so you will face wave after wave of various street toughs, corrupted/misguided cops, cyborgs, syndicate members and all manner of unique adversaries who will try to stop you from interfering with the Y twins diabolical plans. They each have varying behaviors as well as methods of attack and defense so the fighting never gets stale as you will constantly have to adapt to new ways of combating your adversaries not only in abilities but numbers. Sometimes you will find yourself swarmed by enemies with no breathing room so you'll just have to deal with all of them as best as you can in order to survive. In total there are 12 stages spread out in many different locations throughout the city of Wood Oak and at the end of each you will face a \"boss\" character who will test your fighting abilities in a battle of champions. Also just like in the old days, you can choose to go it alone or have up to three people play with you at the same time and no quarters or tokens needed.    This title is a visual masterpiece that takes the classic style of the old school brawler games and updates it for modern times. The game is not only filled with a dazzling array of gorgeous colors and amazing lighting but the animation is absolutely superb. All the playable characters and N.P.C.'s have an astounding amount of animation on them that really breathes alot of life into the game as you play. Whether the characters are walking, standing still or fighting they all look outstanding as they move about. Add to that the myriad of things occurring in the various backgrounds of the many locations that you traverse over the course of the story and the visual appeal of this title soars. This game definitely captures the attention to detail just as the older games did not only with the characters but the environments as well. Layers upon layers of scrolling background and foreground combine nicely with the midground to create a deep sense of immersion while you move through the stages. Speaking of the environments, your battles will start out on the streets but as the story unfolds they will take you to a number of unique and interesting places such as the Police Precinct during a riot, past the decks of a cargo ship and through the sewers...watch out for turtles! From there you'll make your way to Chinatown, get aboard a moving skytrain, pass through an art gallery then a city-wide concert. Last but certainly not least a corporate tower and finally Y island the stronghold of the Y twins. Each of these locations are visually stunning and contain so many details in not only the midground but the foreground and backgrounds as well.  Because I love oldschool and retro games it's a no brainer that I was going to really enjoy the Streets Of Rage 4 soundtrack and I did! Some terrific top of the line musicians collaborated to put this soundtrack together such as Yuzo Koshiro, Olivier Deriviere and Motohiro Kawashima among others. I know it's a strange way to describe it but the music sounds both new and old at the same time and that's part of my fascination with it. Even though I never played any of the previous Streets Of Rage titles, alot of videogame music from this particular genre at that time in the past had a certain sound to it and this soundtrack does a wonderful job of replicating that audio.    As stated previously, I never had the pleasure of playing the original titles in their prime but as a new fan I think I was able to dive into this game and enjoy it just as much as the hardcore fans...probably not because if you've been with a franchise from the beginning there's just nothing like that experience when another sequel comes out. Knowing all the characters, the lore and what happened in each game as well as being able to spot all the easter eggs in the backgrounds that relate to previous titles is something that was completely lost on me as a new player. In the glory days of Streets Of Rage, I was a \"Double Dragon\" guy but playing this title was still a highly enjoyable and very nostalgic experience for me and I will definitely play all the previous games in this excellent franchise.  Replayability is quite high as there are a number of characters to choose from when you play including some unlockable characters from the previous games Streets Of Rage 1-3. It's like a throwback because those unlockable characters look exactly like they appeared in the old titles with the same pixelated appearance and oldschool 8/16-bit sound effects so this was a very cool and once again nostalgic feature. Also, there are a number of modes including Arcade, Battle Rush and Battle Mode not to mention that you can play cooperatively with up to four people offline and two people online.  As for technical problems I never had any but apparently many people on the forums were complaining about crashes with the game? On the downside, without giving away any spoilers, I was a bit disappointed with the games ending but nevertheless the overall experience was quite entertaining. As for extra content, there are a variety of Steam Achievements to hunt down but sadly no Steam Trading Cards to collect. In summary, whether you're a new or old fan this delightful brawler with it's terrific visuals, fantastic oldschool inspired soundtrack and addictive beat 'em up combat will provide hours of fun gameplay so Streets Of Rage 4 is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED to beat 'em up, retro fighting game fans everywhere.", "appid": "985890", "steamid": "profiles/76561198004313984", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "37", "votes_funny": "2", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1592308800.0}
{"text": "这是款容易上手的回合制策略游戏，目的是在一局220回合内完成古埃及的统一大业 。虽然机制不复杂但整个游戏过程其实非常注重策略，一步的疏忽都可能导致好几回合错失了发展的良机，所以精打细算是必须的。各项资源的分配以及均衡发展非常关键，我开始玩的时候容易犯的错误主要是低估胜利条件，过于偏向收集特定的资源却忽视了另外的，比如忽视食物的后果就是到后面造不出工人而无法高速发展，忽视军队又导致无法统一埃及甚至难以抵抗入侵（后期内战还会出来两个7.4k的无敌军队，要不要这样 ）。总之建议多玩几遍熟悉流程，第一遍第二遍输掉游戏是很正常的事。 界面算不上十分华丽但看着非常舒服，各种图案和动画做得都很细致。游戏操作简单易懂，如果对自己玩游戏的能力感到担忧，开局还有简明扼要的教程来教你熟悉玩法。由于是回合制，所以玩起来比较休闲，不用像即时战略那样赶。游戏本身设计遵从历史，到了某个年代会有简要的历史讲述，让玩家丰富知识。 游戏过程有试炼，一方面提高了挑战性而另一方面玩法也相对单一，有些事件是某个回合确定会发生的。固定的开局、固定的资源和建造地等等也难免显得重复。UI的个别表达翻译（英文和中文）不够精确，不过开发组在积极吸纳社区的意见，努力改善。一局游戏最高33分，根据开局选择的难度和试炼完成的情况来决定得分高低，所以如果能看到自己的历史最高分之类的就更好了。另外就是建造菜单会自动翻到最低等级的还没建造的建筑，所以有时候想继续造高等级的还得重新翻回去。 总体来讲游戏本身质量不错，虽然有改进的空间但还是值得推荐。同时感谢开发组与社区的共同努力，当然还要感谢毛哥的测试key和汉化团队负责人Ryan的工作，我有机会贡献出我一点微小的力量。", "appid": "461620", "steamid": "profiles/76561198158969968", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "23", "votes_funny": "5", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1482062400.0}

{"text": "This game is amazing. The only other game I can really compare it to is Analogue: A Hate Story--except Her Story uses video instead of text logs, and you have only your own search strings to guide you through the database.  The story is well-written and haunting, and told in a completely unique way. The game's themes and questions are closely interwoven with your path through the database, even with the most innocuous aspects of the computer interface itself. It's hard to stop mulling over the missing gaps in the interviews and in Hannah's story that will never be filled. The game's fragmented and disordered narrative keeps you from ever getting a sense of completeness, even as you start to piece together the heart of the mystery.  The subtly flickering screen and the pacing of discovering revelations about the story all make this the perfect game to play alone in the dark. Staying up to solve this mystery with my husband late at night, I still got persistent chills. My only complaint about the game is that the mechanisms controlling your paths through the database can, inevitably, be detected with time. You become tempted to game the system if you can. Then, the first time you finish the game, there's information in the credits that will help you find the remaining available videos. But gathering the last missing pieces this way felt much less exciting.  However, I think that was the whole point--that tantalizing block of videos we didn't manage to access until finishing the game didn't actually reveal anything else about the story. The only information we have is all here. {"text": "The Witcher 3 is one of the most impressive games I've ever played, in terms of scope, story, visuals and content. The size of the open world in this game is simply mind blowing, and it's not just a bunch of emptiness and filler. Pretty much every square inch of the world is drenched in absurd detail, and it's so ridiculously good looking you almost can't believe it. So yeah, I was impressed. Beyond that, the story is a great conclusion to the previous two games (though the plot connections are more in the history of the world and the characters, rather than specific story lines, so it's probably OK for newcomers). The characters are written and voiced really well, as always. As for the gameplay, it's pretty good overall. Although the combat can get somewhat repetitive after a while, there are enough different types of scenarios to keep you on your toes, as far as changing up battle tactics and selecting different items and potions to use, etc. As for the story, the main quest is great, but there are also tons and tons of side quests, which make up the main meat of the game. Some of the side quests are very simple and short, but many are just as in-depth as the main story quests. There is very little pointless filler, aside from some collectible-oriented quests. The variety of quests is also excellent - there's a great balance of combat, exploration, and detective work. Oh, and on top of all this, there's also a full-fledged collectible card game you can play, which is really fun. The game does have a few downsides and annoyances that come up every once in a while, so it's not exactly perfect, but the negative points were inconsequential to me, when taken as part of the whole package. I've put over 150 hours into this game (though that's playing with a 100% completion/exploration type of mindset, so your playtime may vary, depending on how deep down the rabbit hole you go), but either way, have no fear that there isn't enough content for the price. In summary, I can say with no reservations that this is one of the few $60 games I've ever played that is actually worth every single penny of the asking price, plus more. So if you enjoy action style RPGs, don't hesitate to pick this up. The only reason I would say not to buy it would be if your PC isn't able to run it well. This is a game that deserves to be seen in its full glory at maximum settings to truly appreciate what a work of art it is.", "appid": "292030", "steamid": "profiles/76561197994527992", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "19", "votes_funny": "2", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1454932800.0}

{"text": "Это будет обычный средне статистический обзор про игру, который вы где либо могли увидеть или услышать на просторах огромного интернета, а так же площадки под название Steam. {"text": "Team Fortress 2 is one of the games I classify as an \"Everybody\" game. TF 2 is a free to play multiplayer FPS game. It isn't the stereotypical \"shoot everything you see\" game though. This game has nine playable classes to choose from. Every one of them has a unique aspect to them. I'm not going to spoil them for you, as a better approach, you should watch the \"Meet The Classes\" videos to get a better description of them. Every class also has their individual weaknesses. Whether it be the Sniper and the Spy, or if it would be the medic and the soldier. Though the community isn't really based upon the basics of the game. They're are purchasable items that everybody and you even, will most likely want at some point. The hats. The coats. The accessories that that one person had that you wanted, but he just killed you and went on his way etc. Resting my case on the items, they're are many styles of gameplay one can take on, making the game have no really OP (Overpowered) people in it. Team Fortress 2 focuses heavily on skill with the individual classes, and while the classes have they're own assortment of community made weapons to choose from, they're is still always something to over-counter it. {"text": "I have never been a fan of rhythm games like Guitar Hero and the like. I am still not a fan of those types of games... except Beat Saber - which completely blew me away. Backtrack to a drunken night playing VR and my wife suggests trying out this \"Beat Saber game\" for a laugh. I thought \"why not\"? After-all, I have the 2 hour refund window in Steam so she can get some VR dance fun and then I can get my money back. Oh boy was I in for a shock... Beat Saber is a VR rhythm game where you attempt to hit oncoming blocks at varying angles and directions, to the beat of music. It also features walls to duck and doge, along with bombs to avoid like the plague. Sounds simple? Well, it is - in theory. It's a game that is instantly accessible by pretty much anyone but that also takes a lot of skill and practice to master. It's an immense amount of fun. There are a number of difficulty options to allow even those with absolutely no sense of rhythm to have fun with game. It rewards practice and is highly addictive. I can honestly say this is one VR game you must try, even if you are like me and don't usually like these kind of games. Although the game lacks a decent number of tracks, you can quickly and easily mod the game and gain access to thousands of user-made content for endless re-playability. The tracks included in the game are pretty good, for the most part and I found a few in particular that were nothing short of excellent. On top of this, the developers have said they are going to be releasing content patches with new songs. The only other \"con\" I can think of with the game is that the jump from Expert to Expert+ difficulty is complete insanity. Where-as on Expert you can do pretty well and get a good feel for the song, Expert+ mode ramps the difficulty up drastically - forcing you to memorize tracks in order to complete them. This difficulty is seen by adding lots more blocks to hit - and this is where you realise that with so many blocks so close together, you just can't see some of them. Some of the fun also gets lost on the way to Expert and Expert+, where smaller, quicker movements are necessary, instead of the enjoyment you get out of performing flashy dance moves with Expert mode. Other than the lack of tracks and the difficulty issue mentioned above, the game is absolutely a must play and I would recommend it to every single VR user. Get yourself the song downloader mod and half of this problem is solved already.", "appid": "620980", "steamid": "profiles/76561198013276841", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "5", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1552564800.0}

{"text": "GamersGoMakers ist, eines von mittlerweile vielen Spielen welches sich mit dem Aufbau eines eigenen Game-Studios beschäftigt und das gelingt richtig gut. Wie eigentlich in jedem Spiel dieser Art beginnen Sie mit Ihrer Spielfigur alleine in einer Garage und beginnen mit dem entwickeln Ihres ersten Spiels. Gesagt getan, das erste mittelmässige Spiel ist entwickelt und das erste Geld fliesst auf unser Konto. Ist diese Schritt erledigt geht es darum das verdiente Geld möglichst klug wieder zu investieren. Das macht man in dem zusätzliche Mitarbeiter anheuert, das Gebäude erweitert oder z.B. Filmlizenzen gekauft werden. Später im Spielverlauf kann in diverse zusätzliche Räume wie auch in Upgrades der Räume investiert werden. Sogar andere Gamestudios können aufgekauft werden, dies erlaubt die parallele Entwicklung mehrerer Spiele. Für mich persönlich ist GamersGoMakers eines der wenigen Spiele dieser Art bei dem ich das Gefühl hatte das die Verteilung der Schwerpunkte bei der Spielentwicklung wirklich vom „Konsumenten“ wahrgenommen werden und auch auf die Bewertung des Spiels auswirken. Trends wirken sich zusätzlich auf die Verkaufszahlen aus. Es kann sein das man ein Spiel(z.B Action / Alien) entwickelt das eine Wertung von 90% hat, sich aber schlechter verkauft als ein Spiel( Krieg / Simulation) mit einer Wertung von 70% wenn der Trend gerade in Richtung Krieg / Simulation geht.  Im Grunde geht es darum möglichst wenig schlechte Spiele zu entwickeln um das Unternehmen finanziell auf Kurs zu halten. PRO Witzige Aufmachung Viele Optionen bei der Entwicklung Realistischer Markt Sehr übersichtlich Coole Spielbewertungen CONTRA Teilweise Probleme bei Savegames Im späteren Spiel für mich persönlich zu wenig Forschungs- Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten Fazit: Meiner Meinung nach das Beste momentan erhältliche Spiel in dieser Richtung.", "appid": "314320", "steamid": "profiles/76561197974376312", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "5", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1424347200.0}
{"text": "This is without a doubt the best Dragon Quest game to date. Epic story, memorable characters and incredibly beautiful visuals will amaze you in every way, there's something of everything for everyone in here and it's been a while since I had so much fun in a game, the hours just seem to fly and I was very sorry when my adventure came to a end. The story is by no means anything new, a child of light must defeat the forces of darkness and save the world, a common recurring theme in many stories yet this simple tale of love and hope will take you through a grand journey of campfire bonding, time travel, puff-puffs and the unique army of smiles, honestly you'll be in constant awe and laughter and long after the story has ended it will stick with you. The characters are equally as charming with each contributing to the story at various points and will have you laughing at their antics and the accompanying personal stories will only endear you to them further. Usually with a game of this magnitude some of the characters tend to be forgotten but I didn't get that feeling here. The visuals and music are rich and atmospheric, which is good because you'll constantly be required to travel back and forth the same areas and having eye-candy is always a plus There's alot to do in here and I mean ALOT, from sidequests, fleshing out a recurring side story to just trying your luck in the casino or horse-racing, there's something to keep you entertained. Dragon quest has always been about maintaining the identity and charm of good ol fashion jrpgs and I'm really happy how the devs have kept the classical feel and nostalgia while making it modern and fresh This is clearly a work of love and to me worth the asking price, show your support and keep the dream alive. 10/10.", "appid": "742120", "steamid": "profiles/76561198087525640", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "41", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1539518400.0}
{"text": "Вера появляется только тогда, когда увиденное превосходит услышенное. {"text": "This is a great game that is really unique. It has a great story, pixel art, atmosphere and music.   The game is not very difficult, it’s linear and not very long (a couple of hours). But worth the money, especially on sale.", "appid": "435530", "steamid": "profiles/76561198811389430", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1581595200.0}
{"text": "I’m a big Alien fan, specially the more horror focused movies, been waiting to play this for a long time and when it went on sale a while ago for 2 bucks I knew I couldn’t miss the chance. First things first, this is THE Alien game and it deserves all the praise it gets, they absolutely nailed it, if you’re a fan of the movies or horror games in general you’ll not be disappointed. The tone is the same as the 1979 movie, you get that feeling of hopelessness and dread everywhere you go. All the levels have that retrofuturistic style that Aliens fans love and the graphics are great,  , if you manage to relax a bit and appreciate the scenery you’ll feel like you’re actually there, this really sets the mood. The soundtrack fits perfectly within the game, filled with screechings and bangings that will get you on the edge. The plot takes place for the most part in a giant space station and it’s your job to find out what the hell is going on, complete your assignment and of course, survive. I found the story to have more depth than the one from the original movie. It’s much more complex than: “There’s an Alien on board, let’s survive and kill it”, you’ll find out that there are a lot of things wrong in this place. It also features some cool references to the series lore, specially in relation to the fate of the Nostromo space ship and the Weyland-Yutani company. You’ll come across some familiar names and places when reading the logs.  The gameplay revolves around getting to a place, collecting stuff, turning on a device and finding new intel, while avoiding enemies and impending death. There’s some backtracking but it doesn’t get repetitive, the changes of environments and pacing really help here. It doesn’t really have those “out of nowhere” jumpscares so that’s a plus. The only “issue” I had is that during almost every mission something goes wrong, by the end of the game you’re already expecting everything to be futile and waiting for the “twist”, after completing something or hitting a buttom I usually went like   or  . Now let’s talk about the star here that is the Xenomorph and oh boy it is ruthless, it really feels like  , playing on the hardest difficulty means that everytime the nasty creature gets to you it’s a one-hit-kill, which make this game EXTREMELY STRESSFUL, because of this I had to take breaks during some “Alien heavy” levels.  The facehuggers are also nasty, they’re quick, hard to spot and they're also a one-hit-kill, your best bet when dealing with them is to destroy their eggs before they hatch. During the encounters with the big Xeno your only options are: To hide, have happy thoughts and pretend it’s not there; Try to avoid it by going around (very effective but not always possible); or scare the damn thing off with fire using your scarce supply of crafting materials and weapons, but guess what, they’re always lurking, they’ll eventually return and there are more than one, you never truly get rid of them.  The problem with the first option is that you can’t hide forever, you’ll eventually have to leave to complete something and the foul creature will manage to track you while you do so. At least you have a motion tracker to help you predict these encounters and avoid them. My strategy usually changed with the mission, sometimes I scared them off with the molotov, some other times I crouched around and through the vents and in some ocasions I just ran for my life.  The Aliens are not the only enemies you’ll encounter and this is where the game gets seriously creepy, the working androids at the station went “haywire” and they’ll try to kill you whenever they spot you. They’re basically killer manequins, saying things like   while choking you to death, very disturbing and unsettling, some levels are filled to the brim with these vile beings. They’re the enemies you’ll encounter the most and sometimes you’ll have to face more than one, at least you can destroy them and they’re easier to avoid. You’ll also face some gun toting humans that can pack some serious punch, but again, they’re easily avoided,  can be killed and there are not that many of them. I mentioned that this game gets extremely stressful, while that sounds like a bad thing and in most cases it is, in this game it’s justifiable, I really hate frustrating games so I wouldnt have played it if that was the case here. I don’t know how the normal difficulties work, haven’t played them yet but in hard it feels like a true horror experience and that’s why It works, it’s hardcore, if you’re expecting sunshine, rainbows or a horror with some kind of comic relief like those PG rated “scary” movies, this is not for you.", "appid": "214490", "steamid": "profiles/76561198075554946", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "16", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1597060800.0}

{"text": "Я не с проста начал обзор с цитаты Ницше, будучи произнесенной в культовой картине  «Бегущий по лезвию бритвы». Именно с этого фильма я начал знакомство с удивительным  киберпанком, именно он являлся эталоном всего жанра в моих глазах и поиграв в «Оbserver_» я понял, что не одинок во взглядах. Только запустив сие произведение, понимаешь с какой душой разработчики пытались воссоздать ту самую атмосферу: весь этот печатный текст на зеленых мониторах, гигантские рекламные вывески, кислотный дождь, ну и разумеется Рутгер Хауэр в главной роли ! Можно заметить, что «Оbserver_» часто сравнивают с «SOMA» и не с проста. Даже при разности этих игр (не в жанровом плане) сюжетом они очень схожи. Только если во второй мы знали на что идем, зачем мы на это идем; то в первой после прохождения получаем больше вопросов, а не ответов. Но кто то как всегда скажет: «Эй ! Это не игра глупая, а ты тупой, раз не понял гениальности сюжетных поворотов !!» Да нет, это вы тупы, если считаете, что добавление сюжетных линий, ведущих в никуда венцом творения сценариста, да он кажись вовсе положил   болт на вторую половину игры. Ощущение, что смотрю некое русское кино с его «Ружьями Бондарчука», за это обидно больше всего. В заключении, хочу отметить, что я не говорю, что вся игра плоха. Как я отметил выше атмосфера гнетущего города выше всяких похвал, саундтрек как минимум не уступающий произведениям Вангелиса, ну и великолепная озвучка великолепного актера не дают игре пасть ниц перед лицом забвения. Если все же решитесь поиграть в сие произведение, то сделайте это до того, как поиграете в «SOMA», возможно вы не будете так разочарованы, как и я. {"text": "Шикарная игра не требующая доната. Играя ещё в 3-го ведьмака мне очень понравилась \"игра-в-игре\" - Гвинт. Позже в 2017 году когда сказали что выходит отдельная игра с этим настольным шедевром, я сразу подал заявку на получение ключа бета тестирования, и терпеливо ждал,параллельно просматривая электронную почту. Ключ пришёл через месяц, был огорчён этим, но всё же решил поиграть, не зря же ждал. Ну а гвинт..... Как вам сказать...Был на тот момент настолько сырой, что поиграв пару матчей, я сразу его удалил, в надежде на то, что готовый продукт будет играбелен. И вот спустя 3 года я решил его снова скачать, и был крайне удивлён. -Игра стала приятной. -Саундтреки отлично вписываются, хотя и немного надоедают когда наиграл 100+ часов. -Шикарный редактор колод, и возможность креативного подбора карт.(Например, от изменения 1 карты, может резко измениться \"геймплей\" ваш винрейт упадёт, либо наоборот поднимется) Играя на одной и той же колоде более 200 каток, вы всё равно можете находить новые связки, и новые способы тактики. -Хорошая система очков наград, можно покупать скины, делать карты и !ВЫИГРЫВАТЬ БЕСПЛАТНЫМИ КОЛОДАМИ! за 0 вложения в игру. -Если есть голова на плечах, то можно легко дойти до 0 лвла(вышки) (Я же это сделал на 153 часу игры) -Интересные истории в батл пассах, я человек который читал Ведьмака, польщён тем, что есть дополнительные истории в самой игре. И в совокупности этих всех параметров мы получаем отличную игру. Только одно но. Это не плохая черта игры, это скорее крик души. Здешние игроки очень любят сдаваться даже на высоких рейтингах, бывает даже такое, что из-за того что они походили 1 не той картой в САМОМ НАЧАЛЕ,они сразу сдаются. Это прошу заметить НА ВЫСОКИХ рейтингах. Для кого-то это будет плюсом, но для меня это минус, я азартный человек и люблю хорошо подумать в карточных играх, а не видеть \"Победа!\" спустя 15 секунд от начала катки. 10Зараз из10 Иииии...Помните....Не всегда бесплатные игры - донатная помойка. {"text": "One of the better experimental games I've ever played here on Steam, and I do mean experimental in every sense of the word. As you play, you begin to feel more and more like a (willing) guinea pig undertaking cryptic tasks while the mastermind observes in amusement from the shadows.  I've been playing Yai Gameworks games for nearly four years now, and I am continually amazed even to this day. You can tell the developer is brimming with creative ideas, as their backlog of unfinished/unreleased games grows right along with a steady stream of finished work. Through it all, they have always been so honest and transparent, which I can appreciate. As a fan it's been fascinating to watch the whole process.  Imagine my suprise to find a few hidden treasures in this particular game which harken back to a few of those games seemingly thought lost or left undone. The developer has found a way to re-imagine and re-purpose their projects (even if only in smaller amounts) as part of something bigger.  Like most of their games, I wouldn't classify it as straight horror. I think of it more as a surreal puzzle/riddle game. If you are a particular fan of decyphering codes and digging through the files of your game, you would absolutely adore this experience. It's established this game is best enjoyed as a group brain-storming excercise, but it's not necessary. In fact, this game is no better enjoyed as a group effort than any other of Yai Gameworks games in my opinion- since they all rely heavily on thinking far outside the box. Browse nearly any forum for their games and you will find threads of multiple minds connecting to work their way through countless puzzles and theories. However, this is the first time it's specifically stated this way. You might be highly antisocial, like me, but why not use this opportunity to step out of your comfort zone for the sake of the game. Who knows, you might just fall in love with it. PHASE 2 & BEYOND EDIT: Honestly, I'm not digging the game as much at this point. It's my least favorite of all of Yai Gamework's releases thus far. The novelty has worn off and the whole experience has become rather frustrating. My enjoyment of it has waned quite a bit. I dislike how difficult or nearly impossible the game is to play solo (now, I say nearly, because a few of us are really trying to go it alone) and how reliant you must be on Discord or Steam forums in order to progress. If we don't have access to GIMP software, are inept with such software or perhaps even have vision or hearing issues, you may not be able to progress at all without relying on someone else for the answers or for having the guts and intestinal fortitude to withstand certain tasks (like the Girl's Graveyard game, or the 101 Floors) For someone as uncomfortable socially as I am, this whole experience can be incredibly hard and slowly chips away at my love for the game.", "appid": "796910", "steamid": "profiles/76561198173569365", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "52", "votes_funny": "2", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1519128000.0}

Причем по очень доступной цене если сравнивать с другими проэктами ААА класса. Идет постоянная отсылка на патриотов об военной экономики и так далее. Сюжет средненький, но от роликов и всей движухи иногда дух захватывает. Кодзима всегда умел классные долгие ролики делать, за что ему поклон)  Сам геймплей поначалу не привычный и муторный, не понимаешь механику на первом часе как и что тут работает, но когда разбираешься с системой мясорубки начинаешь втягиваться, так как прикольно смотреть на это, особенно на каких-нибудь больших роботов или техники которая крошится на куски, словно салат) Особенно хотелось бы отметить обилие босов и битв с ними. Они делятся на несколько тай-мейтов и под каждый такой мейт приходится подстраиваться, взять например курицу которая была с кучей рук, она то удлиняла своё копьё, словно копейщик, то наоборт делал с него некий хлыст. Трудности в игре представлялись в виде того у нас нет лечащей мази (нанонитов) и долгий махыч с босом, перед которым нам нихрена не дают и который убивает и убивает, начинаешь психовать и ошибаешься на мелочах, это очень круто ведь только в японских играх такое. Суть почти всех активностей в том, чтобы что-то найти, собрать или захватить. Есть что сказать и о физике транспорта. Все автомобили ведут себя словно игрушки, невесомые и жутко капризные. Si vous jouez dans l'optique d'être le plus optimisé possible, vos troupes ne vous suivront plus tout le long de la campagne mais devront être remplacées au fur et à mesure que vos commandants gagnent des niveaux (ajoutant par la même occasion plusieurs stratégies en fonction des besoins) La partie empire se trouve elle aussi renforcée, où la gestion de la nourriture est encore plus primordiale qu'avant, surtout si vous avez la mauvaise idée d'envahir en hiver avec peu de réserves. de nombreux bâtiments différents sont également présents, avec un modèle unique par faction. {"text": "\"Toybox Turbos\" ist ein, an den Klassiker \"Micro Machines\" angelehnter, Fun Racer der ebenfalls von den Rennspielexperten Codemasters entwickelt wurde. Der Titel greift die Kindheitsfantasien vieler Spieler auf in dem es Spielzeugautos diverser Fahrzeugkategorien von Bagger bis Dragster in chaotischen Rennen durch Kinderzimmerkulissen gegeneinander antreten lässt. Gameplaytechnisch kann man mit Ausnahme einer Driftmechanik vom Genre-Standard ausgehen. Pro: + Verspieltes Strecken- und Fahrzeugdesign + Vielfältige Singleplayermodi + Große Gameplaytechnische Unterschiede zwischen den Fahrzeugen, ein fetter Kipplaster steuert sich genau so schön träge wie man es erwarten würde + Allgemein fühlt es sich tatsächlich so an als würde man kleine Spielzeugflitzer steuern + Viele Unterschiedliche Boliden + Sehr kurzweilige und actionreiche Rennen + Angemessene KI, selten sind Rennspiel KI's so ausgeglichen + Sehr Unterhaltsamer Mehrspielermodus, wenn auch teilweise durch unfreiwillig amüsante Glitches Contra: - Nur Elimination im Mehrspielermodus spielbar - frustrierendes Streckendesign führt zu viel Trial&Error und Auswendiglernen in zeitabhängigen Modi - Generell täuschen die verschiedenen Spielmodi vor sich zu unterscheiden, letztendlich sind die meisten jedoch nur Variationen von Zeitfahrten - Die Streckenauswahl ist reichlich knapp bemessen - Die Items missen jegliche taktische Finesse wie man es von Genreverwandten à la \"Mario Kart\" kennt, nicht selten entscheidet hauptsächlich das Glück über den Ausgang einer Runde - Vereinzelt können Abstürze auftreten Fazit: Vielleicht orientiert sich \"Toybox Turbos\" zu stark an seinen geistigen Vorgängern, denn an vielen Stellen wirkt das Spiel in puncto Gamedesign schlicht unzeitgemäß und frustiert aufgrunddessen immer wieder. Dennoch lässt sich dem Titel eine gewisse Sogwirkung nicht absprechen das liegt vorallem daran das der essentiellste Teil, das Fahren an sich, sehr gelungen und spaßig ist. Mankind Divided, la primera versión de Batman: Arkham Knight o Nier:Automata sin el uso de FAR, esos sí son ejemplos claros de juegos mal optimizados). La cosa es que el juego cuenta con tantas opciones gráficas, que incluso sobre lo recomendado, esto puede llevar a pensar que está mal optimizado, aquí no hay cabida para el típico cuento que \"es culpa de Denuvo\" y similares. La calidad gráfica de este juego es excepcional que al contar con tantos detalles, llega a ser muy hermoso, dado esto último, es obvio que muchas GPUs ya estarán pidiendo upgrade en caso de que quieras la mejor experiencia. Lo único que sí me quejo es el precio ¿Lo vale?, Sí (siempre y cuando te guste el Western), pero para ser un juego que disfrutaron los peasants un año antes, debería de ser un poco reducido. {"text": "👍", "appid": "460930", "steamid": "profiles/76561198255098659", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1563710400.0}
{"text": "Black Desert Online is a beautiful game, with a ton of things to do to keep you busy.  Like most MMORPG's you can cook, fish, craft, ect. However, what BDO does differently than what I've seen in the past is the worker system and the combat system, the latter is what the game uses as it's main selling point.  The worker system allows you to quest and gain contribution points which you can use to purchase nodes in towns/mines/ect. so that you can work in those areas. By doing this you can hire workers to harvest materials for you and even craft for you. It's a great, passive system for making money within the game and it adds a kind of, strategy style of gameplay that I don't normally see in a good action MMO. You do still have to gather a bit and can't completely rely on workers, but it takes a bit of the grind out of gathering certain materials. As for the combat, it's fast paced and fun as hell. I haven't played a class yet that I don't completely enjoy. Leveling goes by really fast up to level 55 which is where the end game kind of starts.  However, my big issue with the game starts here. When you hit 55 and the game starts to become more about your gear than your level, it begins to get grindy. The game pacing grinds to a halt and it's all about gathering items to either sell to buy better gear, or use to enhance your gear, which has a chance to fail, leaving you grind for more. I get it, it keeps the game going for some people, you don't reach a max strength for months and months of playing, leaving the game entertaining with stuff to do and something to strive for, however the fact that it's so fun up until that point and then kind of shuts down like me when I'm forced to get off my computer leaves something to be desired. Overall though, the game is fun, and even the grind can be pretty fun in smaller doses. I can't do it for more than an hour and a nightly xp grind for the hour where I get bonus xp as a daily reward is stretching it, even with the combat being so fun. There's also questing you can do, life skills as mentioned above, including alchemy, cooking, fishing and more, guild wars, pvp, and they keep adding events pretty consistently to keep players coming back. The game is definitely worth the purchase for the amount of fun you'll recieve from it.  I highly recommend it to anyone who's looking for a new MMO but doesn't like the tab targeting most other MMO's offer.", "appid": "582660", "steamid": "profiles/76561198000526549", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1537444800.0}

{"text": "Brothers - a tale of two sons Who's there? oh well, it's another review of Brothers - a tale of two sons, what else? So, my motivation for playing this game, was basically that I had heard only good things about it. Actually not just \"good\" things, I had heard great things. So I decided that I wanted to try it out, and now I can only take part in the joy, of confirming the awesomeness that is this game. The only thing, that people kept repeating, that's pulling this game a small bit down, is the fact that it only takes about 3-4 hours to beat. I did it in one sitting, and on one hand, it's great to have a short game, with a nice storyline. It always feels good to finish a game, and it's healthy if you tend to have a quickly growing backlog. But on the other hand, it's also nice to have a game, that's abit long, you get to follow the charaters for longer, and get more into the story. Plus, if it's a good game, then there's the obvious advantage of extra gaming content. (When I'm saying a long game, I'm not talking   long, just with a bit more of an ellaborated story). But in the end, I don't think that this game needs to be any longer, in the matter of a fact, I think it has the perfect length, you get a nice insight in the game and the two brothers' adventure to reach their goal. One thing I found really special and unique in this game, is how it manages to create that feeling, of sympathy, and understanding. Even though it's in a completely foreign language. In fact, I pictured myself in their roles so much, that I even started refering to myself in plural. This is definatly one of the most emotional games, I have ever played. At parts, it got me directly sad. Even though this game at the store page, has a note saying \"notice: this game requires a controller\" this is actually not the case. I started this game up, using my gamepad, and given you're playing as two charaters, it takes a second to get used to the double controls. Especially when the brothers switch side of the screen. Anyways, half way into the game, i decided \"hmm, maybe i should try using my keyboard, just for the sake of testing if it works.\" And it does, and while many say that the keyboard controls are much more difficult to use, i actually found it completely opposite, and stuck with it for the rest of the game. The graphics in this game is astonishing, and all over fantastic.   is all over a beautiful game   and not only that, the tremendous amount of stuff you could interact with, simply made the game even funnier, even the two brothes had different ways of ineraction, it was an exploration in itself, just walking around, and watching them react to stuff. You start the game with a cutscene, where you tragically see the mother die at sea.   Afterwards, you slowly fade back into presence. You're playing as two brothers, who has bring their ill father some healing water from the tree of life (atleast that's what it's called in my head xD). They have to pass and solve countless tests and challenges by the use of teamwork and some nice parkour, you start of in your home town, getting slowed down by a simple town-bully, but are yet to find out there are far worse things to worry about, giant trolls, even bigger spiders, invisble snow creatures and all sorts of monsters awaits the two boys, and before they finally reach the tree, they have to survive all these things. and just when you think all is good, twists are happening all around you (no spoilers, go play for yourself)     While almost everything in this game is perfect, it feels like the devs. has done over one particular bit, abit quickly compared to the rest of the game, I'm talking about the soundtrack, while it too has some cool parts to it, I feel like it lags that one epic track, that makes you wanna play the game, over and over again, just for that track, or simply just makes you hum along to it. All in all, I give this game a 9/10 it's an amazing game, the developers did an incredible job on this game, it has every little aspect needed in my opinion, the only thing keeping it from perfection is the soundtrack. So cheers Starbreeze Studios for this game     also, have a few pics :eng:", "appid": "225080", "steamid": "profiles/76561198034875098", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "11", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1393761600.0}

{"text": "Je m'étais rarement laissé me perdre sur un jeu depuis des années, j'ai été capable d'y jouer des journées entière sans me lasser.  Le jeu est très beau, ainsi que la carte qui est immense avec une foule d'activités à faire. Aussi, les paysages sont variés et des endroits vraiment incroyables sont à découvrir. Cet Assassin mise beaucoup sur l'exploration et la curiosité du joueur, l'orientation RPG est encore plus importante que dans le précédent opus Les conséquences sont réellement présente pour nos choix, Le monde est vastes est rend hommage à la Grèce antique ! coup de massue sur coup de massue : distance d'affichage hallucinante, mapping des ombres impressionnant, végétation dense et fine, arrière-plans somptueux, modèles de personnages bluffants, la direction artistique est excellente, les effets de lumières sont vraiment incroyables, même si certaines textures sont un peu grossières, elles restent dans l'ensemble de très bonne facture, l'eau est parfaitement modélisée et le cycle jour/nuit ainsi que les saisons apportent une ambiance très réussie. Une bande son au top sans être envahissante, le doublage français est impeccable. {"text": "TL;DR: Game has an amazing narrative better than some of the MCU movies, with in-depth and addicting combat and RPG elements that make the game re-playable for hours to come. With only minor bugs and some needed improvement in optimization, the game is worth the price especially with friends! Having 30 hours in the first couple days I have to say this game is all I've ever wanted from a Marvel Game: The combat being fun and extremely in-depth when it comes to leveling up your skills trees and combining those elements with the gear you have on to make your superhero feel stronger and more god-like as you progress through a series of different gamemode types. Each character feels like they could star in there own triple-A game when leveled up to the max. The campaign is surprisingly well written and well casted. The story is intriguing with many references and easter eggs to all types of Marvel content along with great visuals, strong narrative, and magnetic characters to feel attached too. The campaign has something for everyone and is absolutely hilarious. The game has a lot after the campaign too, including end-game content and mission types that will keep your team struggling for the best legendary and exotic loot in the game to truly complete your characters. Not to mention faction based missions and daily quests/boss fights. Personally I haven't felt the \"heavy bugs\" of this game and have been fortunate to have almost no crashes, no game-breaking situations or even any multiplayer problems, but I believe there are some issues with that soon to be fixed. The game could work on some things like optimization still, which the developers said they're making a constant effort to improve, also some quality of life changes when it comes to menu and certain areas of the HUB.  None the less this game has A GREAT foundation set to be able to continue endless Marvel characters stories in the future, and will certainly be a top game in the coming months when things are truly polished and optimized, as for right now still totally worth the money for the Marvel experience and content!", "appid": "997070", "steamid": "profiles/76561198083934388", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "4", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1599220800.0}

{"text": "Really, nice resource management game but you manage your kingdom in person, as in real life. When you manage something in real life, you interact with people, delegate jobs, incentivize according to priority. You don't have a Birds/God's eye view of everything, like in other management or Strategy games.   In this game, you can play as a King or Queen, and ride around left and right, marching back and forth, collecting revenue and paying for construction and recruitment. By the end you are riding large distances to each side of your borders. You have to be careful not bite more than you can chew, and stretch your forces too thin, or else you will lose all your progress pretty quickly. Personally, this along with Mount and Blade, gave me a feel of why a medieval ruler had to ride around to points of interest. It made me understand the world better from a ruler's point of view, something most people don't get to experience in real life. Half the fun in a game is figuring things out by yourself, resist the temptation of looking up things. This game is like an appetizer, if you enjoy beating this game. You can try \"Kingdom: New Lands\" and play coop in \"Kingdom Two Crowns\"", "appid": "368230", "steamid": "profiles/76561198414020811", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "4", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1588161600.0}

{"text": "В 2010 году вышла одна замечательная игра - ENSLAVED, которую я по какой-то причине посчитал проходником. Я не успел поиграть в эту игру на консолях, по причине того, что в этом году вышло просто огромное колличество долгостроев, которые я еле-еле успевал проходить. На новое творение Ninja Theory  я просто не обратил внимание.  В издание поступил порт этой игры, который я купил ради любопытства. Что сказать, я абсолютно не прогадал... Больше всего ENSLAVED мне понравился истроией, истроией о людях и взаимоотношениях между ними.  Сюжет игры происходит в 150 годах далекого будущего. Мы играем за Манки. Манки бежит с рабовладельческого корабля. Корабль терпит крушение. После крушения, Майки обнаруживает, что на его голове диадема, которую от безысходности надела молодая девушка - Трип. Она и сама этого не хотела, но ей была нужна чья-то помощь, чтобы добраться до дома. Если Трип погибнет - то погибнет и Манки. Манки ненавидит Трип, за то что она надела на него диадему. В скором времени все преодаленные трудности, все произошедшие несчастья начинают сближать их.  Боевая система отлично подстроена под мышь и клавиатуру. Удары легко комбинируются. Бои выглядят очень эффектно и захватывающе.  Убивая врагов, мы получаем некие сферы, за которые Трип нам улучшает некоторые аспекты возможностей Манки.  В ENSLAVED идеально подобраны актеры для озвучки. Диалоги очень интересные, иногда душещепательные, иногда очень смешные. Чем дольше ты играешь в ENSLAVED, тем больше ты осознаёшь в каком же огромном путешествии ты побывал... Ни одна другая игра не дарит такое количество уникальных эмоций. {"text": "Hyper hardcore is a great game that proves a budget and an entire production studio aren't required to create a fun and unique experience. At its core the game has one simple mechanic - typing. Players who just want a casual indie-type of game can explore the different typing modes (game-modes), while those who want a story to follow can talk to the in-game characters via the chat and explore the surprisingly interesting story-line. The main story can be completed in under an hour, but for those looking for a challenge there are 100 (as of writing) achievements to be unlocked (some of which are hardcore), and an alternative story that can be played through.   The game features a unique UI style that draws inspiration from older text-based interfaces, but puts a refreshing spin on it by incorporating vibrant colors, animations and effects. Overall I found the game very enjoyable and accessible for both casual players and players who want to push their (typing) abilities to the limit. Very recommended, especially considering the low price.", "appid": "1157720", "steamid": "profiles/76561198155707284", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "12", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1584619200.0}

{"text": "So, yet another Sakura title filled with gratuitous shiny boob shots, strange girl on girl groping, and lots of sexy talk for a bunch of people who haven't even had their first kiss yet. So what sets this one apart? Is there anything, really? Surprisingly, yes. In typical Sakura fashion, you have the option to pursue multiple girls. Each route was cute in it's own way. One is a bit lewd still, but the others were more heart warming than I expected. Don't get me wrong, the game is still chock full of the weird, clumsy girls tripping and exposing panties and breasts and whatnot that we all know and love. {"text": "Dead Space was one of the first survival horror games I ever had the joy of playing. My friend gave it to me for a night and told me to play it on the Xbox 360, I was expecting an average horror experience, a few jumpscares here and there, nothing special. What I got was truly overwhelming and forced me to exit the games numerous times. I had to go out and buy this game, I HAD to, and so I did. It quite literally took me around a month to complete; not because it is a truly long game, because I couldn't continuously play it without taking a breather to relax myself. This game puts you on edge, you never know what to expect and you never know when it is going to happen. Throughout my first playthrough I was constantly checking my surroundings, ensuring that I was safe, although when I turned around a necromorph was staring me directly in the face I was on the xbox 360 dashboard quicker than I could've shot the thing.  Although, even after exiting the games countless times, I did not want to stop playing, it's something about Dead Space which made me want to just keep playing, keep discovering the secrets of the USS Ishimura, and keep discovering the eery and isolated atmosphere that Dead Space provides so brilliantly. Overall, I would give this game a solid 10/10, and the only thing I could complain about is that there is no character development for Isaac (main character) whatsoever, as he doesn't have a voice! You quite literally just hear him moan in pain for 11 hours of gameplay. {"text": "I don't understand the negative reviews. The CEO, Swen himself, clearly stated if you don't want to experience this game in Early Access with bugs and all, do not purchase it. The early access has about 1/10th of the content that is going to be available on release. There are optimization issues, buggy cutscenes, etc. I haven't bought a full priced game in many years, but this was a no brainer for me. Divinity Original Sin 2 was my favorite game of all time, and if you enjoyed that game than you will love this. The combat system varies in that it has gone towards a traditional 5e DND style instead of what DOS2 was. The leveling system seems to have been condensed, but I'm only 4 hours in, so its too early to tell. This is the first character creation I actually enjoyed. The character models alone are unlike anything I've ever seen. It's clear the amount of work they put into every customizable feature. The visuals and cutscenes blew me away, and once all the kinks are worked out it will be even more enjoyable. I love the story so far, but once again I've barely started. If you are on the fence, just wait. There is no rush to buy this game. It was released primarily for the people who have been waiting so long for it just to get a taste and be early supporters to make the game into what it will be in the coming months. I wouldn't base your decision on reviews with less than 20 hours, outside of game breaking issues. And those reviews won't be out for at least a week. {"text": "\"Я уже говорил тебе, что такое безумие\"... Именно эти слова и стали визитной карточкой 3-й части Far Cry.  Что она собой являет? 50% оригинального Far Cry, 30% Far Cry 2 и 20% Assassin's Creed. Из первого она получила большие пространства и джунгли, из второго шутерную механику, а из третьего... Вышки, аванпосты, задания, крафт.  По началу я сомневался, стоит ли ее брать, поскольку 2-я часть мне надоела еще на середине, Судите сами - постоянные разъезды по открытому и вдобавок еще мертвому миру с блокпостами, личный состав которых возраждается, только отъедь пару метров. Бред... Потому к 3-й части я с опаской отнесся, но как оказалось, они были напрасными. Начало несколько удивило, но потом когда стало ясно, что это всего лишь запись с камеры, начинается самое интересное, а именно встреча с \"безумием\", он же Ваас Монтенегро, местный лидер пиратов, который \"учит\" уму-разуму нашего героя, Джейсона и его брата Гранта. Дальше все начинается как в классических голливудских боевиках - побег, неожиданные потери близких, неудача и... чудесное спасение, после которого Джейсону придется \"вытереть сопли\" и спасти своих оставшихся в живых друзей из плена и отомстить Ваасу и его начальнику - Хойту.  Кроме основной сюжетной кампании, отдельно хочется вспомнить второстепенные задания, которые как ни странно не надоедают. Это просьбы мирного населения, гонки, азартные игры, сбор всяких ценностей и записок, которые раскрывают историю острова и т.д. Не забыли и охоте, на которой нужно добывать шкуры для изготовления различных прибамбасов. В общем, заняться есть чем. Еще хочу упомянуть локализацию. Перевод просто шикарный, такого эмоционального перевода, я наверное со времен Conflict Vietnam и фаргусовских изданий не припомню. Особенно отличился наш Ваас - Константин Карасик. Не менее круто озвучены и пираты вместе с героями кооперативной кампании.  Что еще сказать? Однозначно игра очень и очень годная, в свое время брал по полной стоимости. Даже перепроходил пару раз на компе и один на X360. В общем, о боже 10 из 10!", "appid": "220240", "steamid": "profiles/76561198165422321", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "4", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1449835200.0}
